69#undef NSS_VERSION_INT
70#define NSS_VERSION_INT ((NSS_VMAJOR << 24) | (NSS_VMINOR << 16) | \
71 (NSS_VPATCH << 8) | NSS_VBUILD)

73/* NSS 3.12.5 and later have NSS_InitContext */
74#if NSS_VERSION_INT >= 0x030c0500
75#define HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT 1
76#endif

79#if NSS_VERSION_INT >= 0x030c0900
80#define HAVE_SECMOD_RESTARTMODULES 1
81#endif

86typedef struct tlsm_ctx {
87 PRFileDesc *tc_model;
88 int tc_refcnt;
89 int tc_unique; /* unique number associated with this ctx */
90 PRBool tc_verify_cert;
91 CERTCertDBHandle *tc_certdb;
92 PK11SlotInfo *tc_certdb_slot;
93 CERTCertificate *tc_certificate;
94 SECKEYPrivateKey *tc_private_key;
95 char *tc_pin_file;
96 struct ldaptls *tc_config;
97 int tc_is_server;
98 int tc_require_cert;
99 PRCallOnceType tc_callonce;
100 PRBool tc_using_pem;
101#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
102 NSSInitContext *tc_initctx; /* the NSS context */
103#endif
104 PK11GenericObject **tc_pem_objs; /* array of objects to free */
105 int tc_n_pem_objs; /* number of objects */
106 PRBool tc_warn_only; /* only warn of errors in validation */
107#ifdef LDAP_R_COMPILE
108 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t tc_refmutex;
109#endif
110} tlsm_ctx;
111
112typedef PRFileDesc tlsm_session;

115#define TLSM_CERTDB_DESC_FMT "ldap(%d)"

117static PRDescIdentity tlsm_layer_id;

128#define PEM_CA_HASH_FILE_SUFFIX_LEN 2

130static SECMODModule *pem_module;

134#define TLSM_PEM_SLOT_CERTS "PEM Token #1"

136#define PK11_SETATTRS(x,id,v,l) (x).type = (id); \
137 (x).pValue=(v); (x).ulValueLen = (l);

139/* forward declaration */
140static int tlsm_init( void );
141
142#ifdef LDAP_R_COMPILE
143
144/* it doesn't seem guaranteed that a client will call
145 tlsm_thr_init in a non-threaded context - so we have
146 to wrap the mutex creation in a prcallonce
147*/
148static ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t tlsm_ctx_count_mutex;
149static ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t tlsm_init_mutex;
150static ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_t tlsm_pem_mutex;
151static PRCallOnceType tlsm_init_mutex_callonce = {0,0};
152
153static PRStatus PR_CALLBACK
154tlsm_thr_init_callonce( void )
155{
156 if ( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init( &tlsm_ctx_count_mutex ) ) {
157 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
158 "TLS: could not create mutex for context counter: %d\n", errno, 0, 0 );
159 return PR_FAILURE;
160 }
161
162 if ( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init( &tlsm_init_mutex ) ) {
163 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
164 "TLS: could not create mutex for moznss initialization: %d\n", errno, 0, 0 );
165 return PR_FAILURE;
166 }
167
168 if ( ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init( &tlsm_pem_mutex ) ) {
169 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
170 "TLS: could not create mutex for PEM module: %d\n", errno, 0, 0 );
171 return PR_FAILURE;
172 }
173
174 return PR_SUCCESS;
175}
176
177static void
178tlsm_thr_init( void )
179{
180 ( void )PR_CallOnce( &tlsm_init_mutex_callonce, tlsm_thr_init_callonce );
181}
182
183#endif /* LDAP_R_COMPILE */
184
185static const char *
186tlsm_dump_cipher_info(PRFileDesc *fd)
187{
188 PRUint16 ii;
189
190 for (ii = 0; ii < SSL_NumImplementedCiphers; ++ii) {
191 PRInt32 cipher = (PRInt32)SSL_ImplementedCiphers[ii];
192 PRBool enabled = PR_FALSE;
193 PRInt32 policy = 0;
194 SSLCipherSuiteInfo info;
195
196 if (fd) {
197 SSL_CipherPrefGet(fd, cipher, &enabled);
198 } else {
199 SSL_CipherPrefGetDefault(cipher, &enabled);
200 }
201 SSL_CipherPolicyGet(cipher, &policy);
202 SSL_GetCipherSuiteInfo(cipher, &info, (PRUintn)sizeof(info));
203 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
204 "TLS: cipher: %d - %s, enabled: %d, ",
205 info.cipherSuite, info.cipherSuiteName, enabled );
206 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
207 "policy: %d\n", policy, 0, 0 );
208 }
209
210 return "";
211}
212
213/* Cipher definitions */
214typedef struct {
215 char *ossl_name; /* The OpenSSL cipher name */
216 int num; /* The cipher id */
217 int attr; /* cipher attributes: algorithms, etc */
218 int version; /* protocol version valid for this cipher */
219 int bits; /* bits of strength */
220 int alg_bits; /* bits of the algorithm */
221 int strength; /* LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH */
222 int enabled; /* Enabled by default? */
223} cipher_properties;
224
225/* cipher attributes */
226#define SSL_kRSA 0x00000001L
227#define SSL_aRSA 0x00000002L
228#define SSL_aDSS 0x00000004L
229#define SSL_DSS SSL_aDSS
230#define SSL_eNULL 0x00000008L
231#define SSL_DES 0x00000010L
232#define SSL_3DES 0x00000020L
233#define SSL_RC4 0x00000040L
234#define SSL_RC2 0x00000080L
235#define SSL_AES 0x00000100L
236#define SSL_MD5 0x00000200L
237#define SSL_SHA1 0x00000400L
238#define SSL_SHA SSL_SHA1
239#define SSL_RSA (SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA)
240
241/* cipher strength */
242#define SSL_NULL 0x00000001L
243#define SSL_EXPORT40 0x00000002L
244#define SSL_EXPORT56 0x00000004L
245#define SSL_LOW 0x00000008L
246#define SSL_MEDIUM 0x00000010L
247#define SSL_HIGH 0x00000020L
248
249#define SSL2 0x00000001L
250#define SSL3 0x00000002L
251/* OpenSSL treats SSL3 and TLSv1 the same */
252#define TLS1 SSL3
253
254/* Cipher translation */
255static cipher_properties ciphers_def[] = {
256 /* SSL 2 ciphers */
257 {"DES-CBC3-MD5", SSL_EN_DES_192_EDE3_CBC_WITH_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_3DES|SSL_MD5, SSL2, 168, 168, SSL_HIGH, SSL_ALLOWED},
258 {"RC2-CBC-MD5", SSL_EN_RC2_128_CBC_WITH_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC2|SSL_MD5, SSL2, 128, 128, SSL_MEDIUM, SSL_ALLOWED},
259 {"RC4-MD5", SSL_EN_RC4_128_WITH_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC4|SSL_MD5, SSL2, 128, 128, SSL_MEDIUM, SSL_ALLOWED},
260 {"DES-CBC-MD5", SSL_EN_DES_64_CBC_WITH_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_DES|SSL_MD5, SSL2, 56, 56, SSL_LOW, SSL_ALLOWED},
261 {"EXP-RC2-CBC-MD5", SSL_EN_RC2_128_CBC_EXPORT40_WITH_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC2|SSL_MD5, SSL2, 40, 128, SSL_EXPORT40, SSL_ALLOWED},
262 {"EXP-RC4-MD5", SSL_EN_RC4_128_EXPORT40_WITH_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC4|SSL_MD5, SSL2, 40, 128, SSL_EXPORT40, SSL_ALLOWED},
263
264 /* SSL3 ciphers */
265 {"RC4-MD5", SSL_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC4|SSL_MD5, SSL3, 128, 128, SSL_MEDIUM, SSL_ALLOWED},
266 {"RC4-SHA", SSL_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC4|SSL_SHA1, SSL3, 128, 128, SSL_MEDIUM, SSL_ALLOWED},
267 {"DES-CBC3-SHA", SSL_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_3DES|SSL_SHA1, SSL3, 168, 168, SSL_HIGH, SSL_ALLOWED},
268 {"DES-CBC-SHA", SSL_RSA_WITH_DES_CBC_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_DES|SSL_SHA1, SSL3, 56, 56, SSL_LOW, SSL_ALLOWED},
269 {"EXP-RC4-MD5", SSL_RSA_EXPORT_WITH_RC4_40_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC4|SSL_MD5, SSL3, 40, 128, SSL_EXPORT40, SSL_ALLOWED},
270 {"EXP-RC2-CBC-MD5", SSL_RSA_EXPORT_WITH_RC2_CBC_40_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC2|SSL_MD5, SSL3, 0, 0, SSL_EXPORT40, SSL_ALLOWED},
271 {"NULL-MD5", SSL_RSA_WITH_NULL_MD5, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_eNULL|SSL_MD5, SSL3, 0, 0, SSL_NULL, SSL_NOT_ALLOWED},
272 {"NULL-SHA", SSL_RSA_WITH_NULL_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_eNULL|SSL_SHA1, SSL3, 0, 0, SSL_NULL, SSL_NOT_ALLOWED},
273
274 /* TLSv1 ciphers */
275 {"EXP1024-DES-CBC-SHA", TLS_RSA_EXPORT1024_WITH_DES_CBC_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_DES|SSL_SHA, TLS1, 56, 56, SSL_EXPORT56, SSL_ALLOWED},
276 {"EXP1024-RC4-SHA", TLS_RSA_EXPORT1024_WITH_RC4_56_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_RC4|SSL_SHA, TLS1, 56, 56, SSL_EXPORT56, SSL_ALLOWED},
277 {"AES128-SHA", TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_AES|SSL_SHA, TLS1, 128, 128, SSL_HIGH, SSL_ALLOWED},
278 {"AES256-SHA", TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA, SSL_kRSA|SSL_aRSA|SSL_AES|SSL_SHA, TLS1, 256, 256, SSL_HIGH, SSL_ALLOWED},
279};
280
281#define ciphernum (sizeof(ciphers_def)/sizeof(cipher_properties))
282
283/* given err which is the current errno, calls PR_SetError with
284 the corresponding NSPR error code */
285static void
286tlsm_map_error(int err)
287{
288 PRErrorCode prError;
289
290 switch ( err ) {
291 case EACCES:
292 prError = PR_NO_ACCESS_RIGHTS_ERROR;
293 break;
294 case EADDRINUSE:
295 prError = PR_ADDRESS_IN_USE_ERROR;
296 break;
297 case EADDRNOTAVAIL:
298 prError = PR_ADDRESS_NOT_AVAILABLE_ERROR;
299 break;
300 case EAFNOSUPPORT:
301 prError = PR_ADDRESS_NOT_SUPPORTED_ERROR;
302 break;
303 case EAGAIN:
304 prError = PR_WOULD_BLOCK_ERROR;
305 break;
306 /*
307 * On QNX and Neutrino, EALREADY is defined as EBUSY.
308 */
309#if EALREADY != EBUSY
310 case EALREADY:
311 prError = PR_ALREADY_INITIATED_ERROR;
312 break;
313#endif
314 case EBADF:
315 prError = PR_BAD_DESCRIPTOR_ERROR;
316 break;
317#ifdef EBADMSG
318 case EBADMSG:
319 prError = PR_IO_ERROR;
320 break;
321#endif
322 case EBUSY:
323 prError = PR_FILESYSTEM_MOUNTED_ERROR;
324 break;
325 case ECONNABORTED:
326 prError = PR_CONNECT_ABORTED_ERROR;
327 break;
328 case ECONNREFUSED:
329 prError = PR_CONNECT_REFUSED_ERROR;
330 break;
331 case ECONNRESET:
332 prError = PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR;
333 break;
334 case EDEADLK:
335 prError = PR_DEADLOCK_ERROR;
336 break;
337#ifdef EDIRCORRUPTED
338 case EDIRCORRUPTED:
339 prError = PR_DIRECTORY_CORRUPTED_ERROR;
340 break;
341#endif
342#ifdef EDQUOT
343 case EDQUOT:
344 prError = PR_NO_DEVICE_SPACE_ERROR;
345 break;
346#endif
347 case EEXIST:
348 prError = PR_FILE_EXISTS_ERROR;
349 break;
350 case EFAULT:
351 prError = PR_ACCESS_FAULT_ERROR;
352 break;
353 case EFBIG:
354 prError = PR_FILE_TOO_BIG_ERROR;
355 break;
356 case EHOSTUNREACH:
357 prError = PR_HOST_UNREACHABLE_ERROR;
358 break;
359 case EINPROGRESS:
360 prError = PR_IN_PROGRESS_ERROR;
361 break;
362 case EINTR:
363 prError = PR_PENDING_INTERRUPT_ERROR;
364 break;
365 case EINVAL:
366 prError = PR_INVALID_ARGUMENT_ERROR;
367 break;
368 case EIO:
369 prError = PR_IO_ERROR;
370 break;
371 case EISCONN:
372 prError = PR_IS_CONNECTED_ERROR;
373 break;
374 case EISDIR:
375 prError = PR_IS_DIRECTORY_ERROR;
376 break;
377 case ELOOP:
378 prError = PR_LOOP_ERROR;
379 break;
380 case EMFILE:
381 prError = PR_PROC_DESC_TABLE_FULL_ERROR;
382 break;
383 case EMLINK:
384 prError = PR_MAX_DIRECTORY_ENTRIES_ERROR;
385 break;
386 case EMSGSIZE:
387 prError = PR_INVALID_ARGUMENT_ERROR;
388 break;
389#ifdef EMULTIHOP
390 case EMULTIHOP:
391 prError = PR_REMOTE_FILE_ERROR;
392 break;
393#endif
394 case ENAMETOOLONG:
395 prError = PR_NAME_TOO_LONG_ERROR;
396 break;
397 case ENETUNREACH:
398 prError = PR_NETWORK_UNREACHABLE_ERROR;
399 break;
400 case ENFILE:
401 prError = PR_SYS_DESC_TABLE_FULL_ERROR;
402 break;
403 /*
404 * On SCO OpenServer 5, ENOBUFS is defined as ENOSR.
405 */
406#if defined(ENOBUFS) && (ENOBUFS != ENOSR)
407 case ENOBUFS:
408 prError = PR_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES_ERROR;
409 break;
410#endif
411 case ENODEV:
412 prError = PR_FILE_NOT_FOUND_ERROR;
413 break;
414 case ENOENT:
415 prError = PR_FILE_NOT_FOUND_ERROR;
416 break;
417 case ENOLCK:
418 prError = PR_FILE_IS_LOCKED_ERROR;
419 break;
420#ifdef ENOLINK
421 case ENOLINK:
422 prError = PR_REMOTE_FILE_ERROR;
423 break;
424#endif
425 case ENOMEM:
426 prError = PR_OUT_OF_MEMORY_ERROR;
427 break;
428 case ENOPROTOOPT:
429 prError = PR_INVALID_ARGUMENT_ERROR;
430 break;
431 case ENOSPC:
432 prError = PR_NO_DEVICE_SPACE_ERROR;
433 break;
434#ifdef ENOSR
435 case ENOSR:
436 prError = PR_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES_ERROR;
437 break;
438#endif
439 case ENOTCONN:
440 prError = PR_NOT_CONNECTED_ERROR;
441 break;
442 case ENOTDIR:
443 prError = PR_NOT_DIRECTORY_ERROR;
444 break;
445 case ENOTSOCK:
446 prError = PR_NOT_SOCKET_ERROR;
447 break;
448 case ENXIO:
449 prError = PR_FILE_NOT_FOUND_ERROR;
450 break;
451 case EOPNOTSUPP:
452 prError = PR_NOT_TCP_SOCKET_ERROR;
453 break;
454#ifdef EOVERFLOW
455 case EOVERFLOW:
456 prError = PR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW_ERROR;
457 break;
458#endif
459 case EPERM:
460 prError = PR_NO_ACCESS_RIGHTS_ERROR;
461 break;
462 case EPIPE:
463 prError = PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR;
464 break;
465#ifdef EPROTO
466 case EPROTO:
467 prError = PR_IO_ERROR;
468 break;
469#endif
470 case EPROTONOSUPPORT:
471 prError = PR_PROTOCOL_NOT_SUPPORTED_ERROR;
472 break;
473 case EPROTOTYPE:
474 prError = PR_ADDRESS_NOT_SUPPORTED_ERROR;
475 break;
476 case ERANGE:
477 prError = PR_INVALID_METHOD_ERROR;
478 break;
479 case EROFS:
480 prError = PR_READ_ONLY_FILESYSTEM_ERROR;
481 break;
482 case ESPIPE:
483 prError = PR_INVALID_METHOD_ERROR;
484 break;
485 case ETIMEDOUT:
486 prError = PR_IO_TIMEOUT_ERROR;
487 break;
488#if EWOULDBLOCK != EAGAIN
489 case EWOULDBLOCK:
490 prError = PR_WOULD_BLOCK_ERROR;
491 break;
492#endif
493 case EXDEV:
494 prError = PR_NOT_SAME_DEVICE_ERROR;
495 break;
496 default:
497 prError = PR_UNKNOWN_ERROR;
498 break;
499 }
500 PR_SetError( prError, err );
501}
502
503/*
504 * cipher_list is an integer array with the following values:
505 * -1: never enable this cipher
506 * 0: cipher disabled
507 * 1: cipher enabled
508 */
509static int
510nss_parse_ciphers(const char *cipherstr, int cipher_list[ciphernum])
511{
512 int i;
513 char *cipher;
514 char *ciphers;
515 char *ciphertip;
516 int action;
517 int rv;
518
519 /* All disabled to start */
520 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++)
521 cipher_list[i] = 0;
522
523 ciphertip = strdup(cipherstr);
524 cipher = ciphers = ciphertip;
525
526 while (ciphers && (strlen(ciphers))) {
527 while ((*cipher) && (isspace(*cipher)))
528 ++cipher;
529
530 action = 1;
531 switch(*cipher) {
532 case '+': /* Add something */
533 action = 1;
534 cipher++;
535 break;
536 case '-': /* Subtract something */
537 action = 0;
538 cipher++;
539 break;
540 case '!': /* Disable something */
541 action = -1;
542 cipher++;
543 break;
544 default:
545 /* do nothing */
546 break;
547 }
548
549 if ((ciphers = strchr(cipher, ':'))) {
550 *ciphers++ = '\0';
551 }
552
553 /* Do the easy one first */
554 if (!strcmp(cipher, "ALL")) {
555 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
556 if (!(ciphers_def[i].attr & SSL_eNULL))
557 cipher_list[i] = action;
558 }
559 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "COMPLEMENTOFALL")) {
560 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
561 if ((ciphers_def[i].attr & SSL_eNULL))
562 cipher_list[i] = action;
563 }
564 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "DEFAULT")) {
565 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
566 cipher_list[i] = ciphers_def[i].enabled == SSL_ALLOWED ? 1 : 0;
567 }
568 } else {
569 int mask = 0;
570 int strength = 0;
571 int protocol = 0;
572 char *c;
573
574 c = cipher;
575 while (c && (strlen(c))) {
576
577 if ((c = strchr(cipher, '+'))) {
578 *c++ = '\0';
579 }
580
581 if (!strcmp(cipher, "RSA")) {
582 mask |= SSL_RSA;
583 } else if ((!strcmp(cipher, "NULL")) || (!strcmp(cipher, "eNULL"))) {
584 mask |= SSL_eNULL;
585 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "AES")) {
586 mask |= SSL_AES;
587 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "3DES")) {
588 mask |= SSL_3DES;
589 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "DES")) {
590 mask |= SSL_DES;
591 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "RC4")) {
592 mask |= SSL_RC4;
593 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "RC2")) {
594 mask |= SSL_RC2;
595 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "MD5")) {
596 mask |= SSL_MD5;
597 } else if ((!strcmp(cipher, "SHA")) || (!strcmp(cipher, "SHA1"))) {
598 mask |= SSL_SHA1;
599 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "SSLv2")) {
600 protocol |= SSL2;
601 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "SSLv3")) {
602 protocol |= SSL3;
603 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "TLSv1")) {
604 protocol |= TLS1;
605 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "HIGH")) {
606 strength |= SSL_HIGH;
607 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "MEDIUM")) {
608 strength |= SSL_MEDIUM;
609 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "LOW")) {
610 strength |= SSL_LOW;
611 } else if ((!strcmp(cipher, "EXPORT")) || (!strcmp(cipher, "EXP"))) {
612 strength |= SSL_EXPORT40|SSL_EXPORT56;
613 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "EXPORT40")) {
614 strength |= SSL_EXPORT40;
615 } else if (!strcmp(cipher, "EXPORT56")) {
616 strength |= SSL_EXPORT56;
617 }
618
619 if (c)
620 cipher = c;
621
622 } /* while */
623
624 /* If we have a mask, apply it. If not then perhaps they provided
625 * a specific cipher to enable.
626 */
627 if (mask || strength || protocol) {
628 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
629 if (((ciphers_def[i].attr & mask) ||
630 (ciphers_def[i].strength & strength) ||
631 (ciphers_def[i].version & protocol)) &&
632 (cipher_list[i] != -1)) {
633 /* Enable the NULL ciphers only if explicity
634 * requested */
635 if (ciphers_def[i].attr & SSL_eNULL) {
636 if (mask & SSL_eNULL)
637 cipher_list[i] = action;
638 } else
639 cipher_list[i] = action;
640 }
641 }
642 } else {
643 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
644 if (!strcmp(ciphers_def[i].ossl_name, cipher) &&
645 cipher_list[i] != -1)
646 cipher_list[i] = action;
647 }
648 }
649 }
650
651 if (ciphers)
652 cipher = ciphers;
653 }
654
655 /* See if any ciphers were enabled */
656 rv = 0;
657 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
658 if (cipher_list[i] == 1)
659 rv = 1;
660 }
661
662 free(ciphertip);
663
664 return rv;
665}
666
667static int
668tlsm_parse_ciphers(tlsm_ctx *ctx, const char *str)
669{
670 int cipher_state[ciphernum];
671 int rv, i;
672
673 if (!ctx)
674 return 0;
675
676 rv = nss_parse_ciphers(str, cipher_state);
677
678 if (rv) {
679 /* First disable everything */
680 for (i = 0; i < SSL_NumImplementedCiphers; i++)
681 SSL_CipherPrefSet(ctx->tc_model, SSL_ImplementedCiphers[i], SSL_NOT_ALLOWED);
682
683 /* Now enable what was requested */
684 for (i=0; i<ciphernum; i++) {
685 SSLCipherSuiteInfo suite;
686 PRBool enabled;
687
688 if (SSL_GetCipherSuiteInfo(ciphers_def[i].num, &suite, sizeof suite)
689 == SECSuccess) {
690 enabled = cipher_state[i] < 0 ? 0 : cipher_state[i];
691 if (enabled == SSL_ALLOWED) {
692 if (PK11_IsFIPS() && !suite.isFIPS)
693 enabled = SSL_NOT_ALLOWED;
694 }
695 SSL_CipherPrefSet(ctx->tc_model, ciphers_def[i].num, enabled);
696 }
697 }
698 }
699
700 return rv == 1 ? 0 : -1;
701}
702
703static SECStatus
704tlsm_bad_cert_handler(void *arg, PRFileDesc *ssl)
705{
706 SECStatus success = SECSuccess;
707 PRErrorCode err;
708 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)arg;
709
710 if (!ssl || !ctx) {
711 return SECFailure;
712 }
713
714 err = PORT_GetError();
715
716 switch (err) {
717 case SEC_ERROR_UNTRUSTED_ISSUER:
718 case SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER:
719 case SEC_ERROR_EXPIRED_CERTIFICATE:
720 case SEC_ERROR_EXPIRED_ISSUER_CERTIFICATE:
721 if (ctx->tc_verify_cert) {
722 success = SECFailure;
723 }
724 break;
725 /* we bypass NSS's hostname checks and do our own */
726 case SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN:
727 break;
728 default:
729 success = SECFailure;
730 break;
731 }
732
733 return success;
734}
735
736static const char *
737tlsm_dump_security_status(PRFileDesc *fd)
738{
739 char * cp; /* bulk cipher name */
740 char * ip; /* cert issuer DN */
741 char * sp; /* cert subject DN */
742 int op; /* High, Low, Off */
743 int kp0; /* total key bits */
744 int kp1; /* secret key bits */
745 SSL3Statistics * ssl3stats = SSL_GetStatistics();
746
747 SSL_SecurityStatus( fd, &op, &cp, &kp0, &kp1, &ip, &sp );
748 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
749 "TLS certificate verification: subject: %s, issuer: %s, cipher: %s, ",
750 sp ? sp : "-unknown-", ip ? ip : "-unknown-", cp ? cp : "-unknown-" );
751 PR_Free(cp);
752 PR_Free(ip);
753 PR_Free(sp);
754 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
755 "security level: %s, secret key bits: %d, total key bits: %d, ",
756 ((op == SSL_SECURITY_STATUS_ON_HIGH) ? "high" :
757 ((op == SSL_SECURITY_STATUS_ON_LOW) ? "low" : "off")),
758 kp1, kp0 );
759
760 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
761 "cache hits: %ld, cache misses: %ld, cache not reusable: %ld\n",
762 ssl3stats->hch_sid_cache_hits, ssl3stats->hch_sid_cache_misses,
763 ssl3stats->hch_sid_cache_not_ok );
764
765 return "";
766}
767
768static void
769tlsm_handshake_complete_cb( PRFileDesc *fd, void *client_data )
770{
771 tlsm_dump_security_status( fd );
772}
773
774#ifdef READ_PASSWORD_FROM_FILE
775static char *
776tlsm_get_pin_from_file(const char *token_name, tlsm_ctx *ctx)
777{
778 char *pwdstr = NULL;
779 char *contents = NULL;
780 char *lasts = NULL;
781 char *line = NULL;
782 char *candidate = NULL;
783 PRFileInfo file_info;
784 PRFileDesc *pwd_fileptr = PR_Open( ctx->tc_pin_file, PR_RDONLY, 00400 );
785
786 /* open the password file */
787 if ( !pwd_fileptr ) {
788 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
789 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
790 "TLS: could not open security pin file %s - error %d:%s.\n",
791 ctx->tc_pin_file, errcode,
792 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
793 goto done;
794 }
795
796 /* get the file size */
797 if ( PR_SUCCESS != PR_GetFileInfo( ctx->tc_pin_file, &file_info ) ) {
798 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
799 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
800 "TLS: could not get file info from pin file %s - error %d:%s.\n",
801 ctx->tc_pin_file, errcode,
802 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
803 goto done;
804 }
805
806 /* create a buffer to hold the file contents */
807 if ( !( contents = PR_CALLOC( file_info.size + 1 ) ) ) {
808 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
809 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
810 "TLS: could not alloc a buffer for contents of pin file %s - error %d:%s.\n",
811 ctx->tc_pin_file, errcode,
812 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
813 goto done;
814 }
815
816 /* read file into the buffer */
817 if( PR_Read( pwd_fileptr, contents, file_info.size ) <= 0 ) {
818 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
819 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
820 "TLS: could not read the file contents from pin file %s - error %d:%s.\n",
821 ctx->tc_pin_file, errcode,
822 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
823 goto done;
824 }
825
826 /* format is [tokenname:]password EOL [tokenname:]password EOL ... */
827 /* if you want to use a password containing a colon character, use
828 the special tokenname "default" */
829 for ( line = PL_strtok_r( contents, "\r\n", &lasts ); line;
830 line = PL_strtok_r( NULL, "\r\n", &lasts ) ) {
831 char *colon;
832
833 if ( !*line ) {
834 continue; /* skip blank lines */
835 }
836 colon = PL_strchr( line, ':' );
837 if ( colon ) {
838 if ( *(colon + 1) && token_name &&
839 !PL_strncmp( token_name, line, colon-line ) ) {
840 candidate = colon + 1; /* found a definite match */
841 break;
842 } else if ( !PL_strncmp( DEFAULT_TOKEN_NAME, line, colon-line ) ) {
843 candidate = colon + 1; /* found possible match */
844 }
845 } else { /* no token name */
846 candidate = line;
847 }
848 }
849done:
850 if ( pwd_fileptr ) {
851 PR_Close( pwd_fileptr );
852 }
853 if ( candidate ) {
854 pwdstr = PL_strdup( candidate );
855 }
856 PL_strfree( contents );
857
858 return pwdstr;
859}
860#endif /* READ_PASSWORD_FROM_FILE */
861
862#ifdef READ_PASSWORD_FROM_STDIN
863/*
864 * Turn the echoing off on a tty.
865 */
866static void
867echoOff(int fd)
868{
869 if ( isatty( fd ) ) {
870 struct termios tio;
871 tcgetattr( fd, &tio );
872 tio.c_lflag &= ~ECHO;
873 tcsetattr( fd, TCSAFLUSH, &tio );
874 }
875}
876
877/*
878 * Turn the echoing on on a tty.
879 */
880static void
881echoOn(int fd)
882{
883 if ( isatty( fd ) ) {
884 struct termios tio;
885 tcgetattr( fd, &tio );
886 tio.c_lflag |= ECHO;
887 tcsetattr( fd, TCSAFLUSH, &tio );
888 tcsetattr( fd, TCSAFLUSH, &tio );
889 }
890}
891#endif /* READ_PASSWORD_FROM_STDIN */
892
893/*
894 * This does the actual work of reading the pin/password/pass phrase
895 */
896static char *
897tlsm_get_pin(PK11SlotInfo *slot, PRBool retry, tlsm_ctx *ctx)
898{
899 char *token_name = NULL;
900 char *pwdstr = NULL;
901
902 token_name = PK11_GetTokenName( slot );
903#ifdef READ_PASSWORD_FROM_FILE
904 /* Try to get the passwords from the password file if it exists.
905 * THIS IS UNSAFE and is provided for convenience only. Without this
906 * capability the server would have to be started in foreground mode
907 * if using an encrypted key.
908 */
909 if ( ctx && ctx->tc_pin_file ) {
910 pwdstr = tlsm_get_pin_from_file( token_name, ctx );
911 if ( retry && pwdstr != NULL )
912 return NULL;
913 }
914#endif /* RETRIEVE_PASSWORD_FROM_FILE */
915#ifdef READ_PASSWORD_FROM_STDIN
916 if ( !pwdstr ) {
917 int infd = PR_FileDesc2NativeHandle( PR_STDIN );
918 int isTTY = isatty( infd );
919 unsigned char phrase[200];
920 /* Prompt for password */
921 if ( isTTY ) {
922 fprintf( stdout,
923 "Please enter pin, password, or pass phrase for security token '%s': ",
924 token_name ? token_name : DEFAULT_TOKEN_NAME );
925 echoOff( infd );
926 }
927 fgets( (char*)phrase, sizeof(phrase), stdin );
928 if ( isTTY ) {
929 fprintf( stdout, "\n" );
930 echoOn( infd );
931 }
932 /* stomp on newline */
933 phrase[strlen((char*)phrase)-1] = 0;
934
935 pwdstr = PL_strdup( (char*)phrase );
936 }
937
938#endif /* READ_PASSWORD_FROM_STDIN */
939 return pwdstr;
940}
941
942/*
943 * PKCS11 devices (including the internal softokn cert/key database)
944 * may be protected by a pin or password or even pass phrase
945 * MozNSS needs a way for the user to provide that
946 */
947static char *
948tlsm_pin_prompt(PK11SlotInfo *slot, PRBool retry, void *arg)
949{
950 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)arg;
951
952 return tlsm_get_pin( slot, retry, ctx );
953}
954
955static char *
956tlsm_ctx_subject_name(tlsm_ctx *ctx)
957{
958 if ( !ctx || !ctx->tc_certificate )
959 return "(unknown)";
960
961 return ctx->tc_certificate->subjectName;
962}
963
964static SECStatus
965tlsm_get_basic_constraint_extension( CERTCertificate *cert,
966 CERTBasicConstraints *cbcval )
967{
968 SECItem encodedVal = { 0, NULL };
969 SECStatus rc;
970
971 rc = CERT_FindCertExtension( cert, SEC_OID_X509_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS,
972 &encodedVal);
973 if ( rc != SECSuccess ) {
974 return rc;
975 }
976
977 rc = CERT_DecodeBasicConstraintValue( cbcval, &encodedVal );
978
979 /* free the raw extension data */
980 PORT_Free( encodedVal.data );
981
982 return rc;
983}
984
985static PRBool
986tlsm_cert_is_self_issued( CERTCertificate *cert )
987{
988 /* A cert is self-issued if its subject and issuer are equal and
989 * both are of non-zero length.
990 */
991 PRBool is_self_issued = cert &&
992 (PRBool)SECITEM_ItemsAreEqual( &cert->derIssuer,
993 &cert->derSubject ) &&
994 cert->derSubject.len > 0;
995 return is_self_issued;
996}
997
998/*
999 * The private key for used certificate can be already unlocked by other
1000 * thread or library. Find the unlocked key if possible.
1001 */
1002static SECKEYPrivateKey *
1003tlsm_find_unlocked_key( tlsm_ctx *ctx, void *pin_arg )
1004{
1005 SECKEYPrivateKey *result = NULL;
1006
1007 PK11SlotList *slots = PK11_GetAllSlotsForCert( ctx->tc_certificate, NULL );
1008 if ( !slots ) {
1009 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1010 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1011 "TLS: cannot get all slots for certificate '%s' (error %d: %s)",
1012 tlsm_ctx_subject_name( ctx ), errcode,
1013 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1014 return result;
1015 }
1016
1017 PK11SlotListElement *le;
1018 for ( le = slots->head; le; le = le->next ) {
1019 PK11SlotInfo *slot = le->slot;
1020 if ( PK11_IsLoggedIn( slot, NULL ) ) {
1021 result = PK11_FindKeyByDERCert( slot, ctx->tc_certificate, pin_arg );
1022 break;
1023 }
1024 }
1025
1026 PK11_FreeSlotList( slots );
1027 return result;
1028}
1029
1030static SECStatus
1031tlsm_verify_cert(CERTCertDBHandle *handle, CERTCertificate *cert, void *pinarg,
1032 PRBool checksig, SECCertificateUsage certUsage, PRBool warn_only,
1033 PRBool ignore_issuer )
1034{
1035 CERTVerifyLog verifylog;
1036 SECStatus ret = SECSuccess;
1037 const char *name;
1038 int debug_level = LDAP_DEBUG_ANY;
1039
1040 if ( warn_only ) {
1041 debug_level = LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE;
1042 }
1043
1044 /* the log captures information about every cert in the chain, so we can tell
1045 which cert caused the problem and what the problem was */
1046 memset( &verifylog, 0, sizeof( verifylog ) );
1047 verifylog.arena = PORT_NewArena( DER_DEFAULT_CHUNKSIZE );
1048 if ( verifylog.arena == NULL ) {
1049 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1050 "TLS certificate verification: Out of memory for certificate verification logger\n",
1051 0, 0, 0 );
1052 return SECFailure;
1053 }
1054 ret = CERT_VerifyCertificate( handle, cert, checksig, certUsage, PR_Now(), pinarg, &verifylog,
1055 NULL );
1056 if ( ( name = cert->subjectName ) == NULL ) {
1057 name = cert->nickname;
1058 }
1059 if ( verifylog.head == NULL ) {
1060 /* it is possible for CERT_VerifyCertificate return with an error with no logging */
1061 if ( ret != SECSuccess ) {
1062 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1063 Debug( debug_level,
1064 "TLS: certificate [%s] is not valid - error %d:%s.\n",
1065 name ? name : "(unknown)",
1066 errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1067 }
1068 } else {
1069 const char *name;
1070 CERTVerifyLogNode *node;
1071
1072 ret = SECSuccess; /* reset */
1073 node = verifylog.head;
1074 while ( node ) {
1075 if ( ( name = node->cert->subjectName ) == NULL ) {
1076 name = node->cert->nickname;
1077 }
1078 if ( node->error ) {
1079 /* NSS does not like CA certs that have the basic constraints extension
1080 with the CA flag set to FALSE - openssl doesn't check if the cert
1081 is self issued */
1082 if ( ( node->error == SEC_ERROR_CA_CERT_INVALID ) &&
1083 tlsm_cert_is_self_issued( node->cert ) ) {
1084
1085 PRErrorCode orig_error = PR_GetError();
1086 PRInt32 orig_oserror = PR_GetOSError();
1087
1088 CERTBasicConstraints basicConstraint;
1089 SECStatus rv = tlsm_get_basic_constraint_extension( node->cert, &basicConstraint );
1090 if ( ( rv == SECSuccess ) && ( basicConstraint.isCA == PR_FALSE ) ) {
1091 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1092 "TLS: certificate [%s] is not correct because it is a CA cert and the "
1093 "BasicConstraint CA flag is set to FALSE - allowing for now, but "
1094 "please fix your certs if possible\n", name, 0, 0 );
1095 } else { /* does not have basicconstraint, or some other error */
1096 ret = SECFailure;
1097 Debug( debug_level,
1098 "TLS: certificate [%s] is not valid - CA cert is not valid\n",
1099 name, 0, 0 );
1100 }
1101
1102 PR_SetError( orig_error, orig_oserror );
1103
1104 } else if ( warn_only || ( ignore_issuer && (
1105 node->error == SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER ||
1106 node->error == SEC_ERROR_UNTRUSTED_ISSUER )
1107 ) ) {
1108 ret = SECSuccess;
1109 Debug( debug_level,
1110 "TLS: Warning: ignoring error for certificate [%s] - error %ld:%s.\n",
1111 name, node->error, PR_ErrorToString( node->error, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1112 } else {
1113 ret = SECFailure;
1114 Debug( debug_level,
1115 "TLS: certificate [%s] is not valid - error %ld:%s.\n",
1116 name, node->error, PR_ErrorToString( node->error, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1117 }
1118 }
1119 CERT_DestroyCertificate( node->cert );
1120 node = node->next;
1121 }
1122 }
1123
1124 PORT_FreeArena( verifylog.arena, PR_FALSE );
1125
1126 if ( ret == SECSuccess ) {
1127 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1128 "TLS: certificate [%s] is valid\n", name, 0, 0 );
1129 }
1130
1131 return ret;
1132}
1133
1134static SECStatus
1135tlsm_auth_cert_handler(void *arg, PRFileDesc *fd,
1136 PRBool checksig, PRBool isServer)
1137{
1138 SECCertificateUsage certUsage = isServer ? certificateUsageSSLClient : certificateUsageSSLServer;
1139 SECStatus ret = SECSuccess;
1140 CERTCertificate *peercert = SSL_PeerCertificate( fd );
1141 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)arg;
1142
1143 ret = tlsm_verify_cert( ctx->tc_certdb, peercert,
1144 SSL_RevealPinArg( fd ),
1145 checksig, certUsage, ctx->tc_warn_only, PR_FALSE );
1146 CERT_DestroyCertificate( peercert );
1147
1148 return ret;
1149}
1150
1151static SECStatus
1152tlsm_nss_shutdown_cb( void *appData, void *nssData )
1153{
1154 SECStatus rc = SECSuccess;
1155
1156 SSL_ShutdownServerSessionIDCache();
1157
1158 if ( pem_module ) {
1159 SECMOD_UnloadUserModule( pem_module );
1160 SECMOD_DestroyModule( pem_module );
1161 pem_module = NULL;
1162 }
1163 return rc;
1164}
1165
1166static PRCallOnceType tlsm_register_shutdown_callonce = {0,0};
1167static PRStatus PR_CALLBACK
1168tlsm_register_nss_shutdown_cb( void )
1169{
1170 if ( SECSuccess == NSS_RegisterShutdown( tlsm_nss_shutdown_cb,
1171 NULL ) ) {
1172 return PR_SUCCESS;
1173 }
1174 return PR_FAILURE;
1175}
1176
1177static PRStatus
1178tlsm_register_nss_shutdown( void )
1179{
1180 return PR_CallOnce( &tlsm_register_shutdown_callonce,
1181 tlsm_register_nss_shutdown_cb );
1182}
1183
1184static int
1185tlsm_init_pem_module( void )
1186{
1187 int rc = 0;
1188 char *fullname = NULL;
1189 char *configstring = NULL;
1190
1191 if ( pem_module ) {
1192 return rc;
1193 }
1194
1195 /* not loaded - load it */
1196 /* get the system dependent library name */
1197 fullname = PR_GetLibraryName( NULL, PEM_LIBRARY );
1198 /* Load our PKCS#11 module */
1199 configstring = PR_smprintf( "library=%s name=" PEM_MODULE " parameters=\"\"", fullname );
1200 PL_strfree( fullname );
1201
1202 pem_module = SECMOD_LoadUserModule( configstring, NULL, PR_FALSE );
1203 PR_smprintf_free( configstring );
1204
1205 if ( !pem_module || !pem_module->loaded ) {
1206 if ( pem_module ) {
1207 SECMOD_DestroyModule( pem_module );
1208 pem_module = NULL;
1209 }
1210 rc = -1;
1211 }
1212
1213 return rc;
1214}
1215
1216static void
1217tlsm_add_pem_obj( tlsm_ctx *ctx, PK11GenericObject *obj )
1218{
1219 int idx = ctx->tc_n_pem_objs;
1220 ctx->tc_n_pem_objs++;
1221 ctx->tc_pem_objs = (PK11GenericObject **)
1222 PORT_Realloc( ctx->tc_pem_objs, ctx->tc_n_pem_objs * sizeof( PK11GenericObject * ) );
1223 ctx->tc_pem_objs[idx] = obj;
1224}
1225
1226static void
1227tlsm_free_pem_objs( tlsm_ctx *ctx )
1228{
1229 /* free in reverse order of allocation */
1230 while ( ctx->tc_n_pem_objs-- ) {
1231 PK11_DestroyGenericObject( ctx->tc_pem_objs[ctx->tc_n_pem_objs] );
1232 ctx->tc_pem_objs[ctx->tc_n_pem_objs] = NULL;
1233 }
1234 PORT_Free(ctx->tc_pem_objs);
1235 ctx->tc_pem_objs = NULL;
1236 ctx->tc_n_pem_objs = 0;
1237}
1238
1239static int
1240tlsm_add_cert_from_file( tlsm_ctx *ctx, const char *filename, PRBool isca )
1241{
1242 PK11SlotInfo *slot;
1243 PK11GenericObject *cert;
1244 CK_ATTRIBUTE attrs[4];
1245 CK_BBOOL cktrue = CK_TRUE;
1246 CK_BBOOL ckfalse = CK_FALSE;
1247 CK_OBJECT_CLASS objClass = CKO_CERTIFICATE;
1248 char *slotname;
1249 PRFileInfo fi;
1250 PRStatus status;
1251 SECItem certDER = { 0, NULL, 0 };
1252
1253 memset( &fi, 0, sizeof(fi) );
1254 status = PR_GetFileInfo( filename, &fi );
1255 if ( PR_SUCCESS != status) {
1256 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1257 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1258 "TLS: could not read certificate file %s - error %d:%s.\n",
1259 filename, errcode,
1260 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1261 return -1;
1262 }
1263
1264 if ( fi.type != PR_FILE_FILE ) {
1265 PR_SetError(PR_IS_DIRECTORY_ERROR, 0);
1266 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1267 "TLS: error: the certificate file %s is not a file.\n",
1268 filename, 0 ,0 );
1269 return -1;
1270 }
1271
1272 slotname = isca ? TLSM_PEM_SLOT_CACERTS : TLSM_PEM_SLOT_CERTS;
1273 slot = PK11_FindSlotByName( slotname );
1274
1275 if ( !slot ) {
1276 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1277 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1278 "TLS: could not find the slot for the certificate '%s' - error %d:%s.\n",
1279 filename, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1280 return -1;
1281 }
1282
1283 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[0], CKA_CLASS, &objClass, sizeof( objClass ) );
1284 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[1], CKA_TOKEN, &cktrue, sizeof( CK_BBOOL ) );
1285 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[2], CKA_LABEL, (unsigned char *) filename, strlen( filename ) + 1 );
1286 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[3], CKA_TRUST, isca ? &cktrue : &ckfalse, sizeof( CK_BBOOL ) );
1287
1288 cert = PK11_CreateGenericObject( slot, attrs, 4, PR_FALSE /* isPerm */ );
1289
1290 if ( !cert ) {
1291 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1292 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1293 "TLS: could not add the certificate '%s' - error %d:%s.\n",
1294 filename, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1295 PK11_FreeSlot( slot );
1296 return -1;
1297 }
1298
1299 /* if not CA, we store the certificate in ctx->tc_certificate */
1300 if ( !isca ) {
1301 if ( PK11_ReadRawAttribute( PK11_TypeGeneric, cert, CKA_VALUE, &certDER ) != SECSuccess ) {
1302 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1303 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1304 "TLS: could not get DER of the '%s' certificate - error %d:%s.\n",
1305 filename, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1306 PK11_DestroyGenericObject( cert );
1307 PK11_FreeSlot( slot );
1308 return -1;
1309 }
1310
1311 ctx->tc_certificate = PK11_FindCertFromDERCertItem( slot, &certDER, NULL );
1312 SECITEM_FreeItem( &certDER, PR_FALSE );
1313
1314 if ( !ctx->tc_certificate ) {
1315 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1316 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1317 "TLS: could not get certificate '%s' using DER - error %d:%s.\n",
1318 filename, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1319 PK11_DestroyGenericObject( cert );
1320 PK11_FreeSlot( slot );
1321 return -1;
1322 }
1323 }
1324
1325 tlsm_add_pem_obj( ctx, cert );
1326
1327 PK11_FreeSlot( slot );
1328
1329 return 0;
1330}
1331
1332static int
1333tlsm_ctx_load_private_key( tlsm_ctx *ctx )
1334{
1335 if ( !ctx->tc_certificate )
1336 return -1;
1337
1338 if ( ctx->tc_private_key )
1339 return 0;
1340
1341 void *pin_arg = SSL_RevealPinArg( ctx->tc_model );
1342
1343 SECKEYPrivateKey *unlocked_key = tlsm_find_unlocked_key( ctx, pin_arg );
1344 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1345 "TLS: %s unlocked certificate for certificate '%s'.\n",
1346 unlocked_key ? "found" : "no", tlsm_ctx_subject_name( ctx ), 0 );
1347
1348 /* prefer unlocked key, then key from opened certdb, then any other */
1349 if ( unlocked_key )
1350 ctx->tc_private_key = unlocked_key;
1351 else if ( ctx->tc_certdb_slot )
1352 ctx->tc_private_key = PK11_FindKeyByDERCert( ctx->tc_certdb_slot, ctx->tc_certificate, pin_arg );
1353 else
1354 ctx->tc_private_key = PK11_FindKeyByAnyCert( ctx->tc_certificate, pin_arg );
1355
1356 if ( !ctx->tc_private_key ) {
1357 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1358 Debug(LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1359 "TLS: cannot find private key for certificate '%s' (error %d: %s)",
1360 tlsm_ctx_subject_name( ctx ), errcode,
1361 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1362 return -1;
1363 }
1364
1365 return 0;
1366}
1367
1368static int
1369tlsm_add_key_from_file( tlsm_ctx *ctx, const char *filename )
1370{
1371 PK11SlotInfo * slot = NULL;
1372 PK11GenericObject *key;
1373 CK_ATTRIBUTE attrs[3];
1374 CK_BBOOL cktrue = CK_TRUE;
1375 CK_OBJECT_CLASS objClass = CKO_PRIVATE_KEY;
1376 int retcode = 0;
1377 PRFileInfo fi;
1378 PRStatus status;
1379
1380 memset( &fi, 0, sizeof(fi) );
1381 status = PR_GetFileInfo( filename, &fi );
1382 if ( PR_SUCCESS != status) {
1383 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1384 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1385 "TLS: could not read key file %s - error %d:%s.\n",
1386 filename, errcode,
1387 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1388 return -1;
1389 }
1390
1391 if ( fi.type != PR_FILE_FILE ) {
1392 PR_SetError(PR_IS_DIRECTORY_ERROR, 0);
1393 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1394 "TLS: error: the key file %s is not a file.\n",
1395 filename, 0 ,0 );
1396 return -1;
1397 }
1398
1399 slot = PK11_FindSlotByName( TLSM_PEM_SLOT_CERTS );
1400
1401 if ( !slot ) {
1402 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1403 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1404 "TLS: could not find the slot for the private key '%s' - error %d:%s.\n",
1405 filename, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1406 return -1;
1407 }
1408
1409 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[0], CKA_CLASS, &objClass, sizeof( objClass ) );
1410 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[1], CKA_TOKEN, &cktrue, sizeof( CK_BBOOL ) );
1411 PK11_SETATTRS( attrs[2], CKA_LABEL, (unsigned char *)filename, strlen( filename ) + 1 );
1412
1413 key = PK11_CreateGenericObject( slot, attrs, 3, PR_FALSE /* isPerm */ );
1414
1415 if ( !key ) {
1416 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1417 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1418 "TLS: could not add the private key '%s' - error %d:%s.\n",
1419 filename, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1420 retcode = -1;
1421 } else {
1422 tlsm_add_pem_obj( ctx, key );
1423 retcode = 0;
1424
1425 /* When adding an encrypted key the PKCS#11 will be set as removed */
1426 /* This will force the token to be seen as re-inserted */
1427 SECMOD_WaitForAnyTokenEvent( pem_module, 0, 0 );
1428 PK11_IsPresent( slot );
1429 }
1430
1431 PK11_FreeSlot( slot );
1432
1433 return retcode;
1434}
1435
1436static int
1437tlsm_init_ca_certs( tlsm_ctx *ctx, const char *cacertfile, const char *cacertdir )
1438{
1439 PRBool isca = PR_TRUE;
1440 PRStatus status = PR_SUCCESS;
1441 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_SUCCESS;
1442
1443 if ( !cacertfile && !cacertdir ) {
1444 /* no checking - not good, but allowed */
1445 return 0;
1446 }
1447
1448 if ( cacertfile ) {
1449 int rc = tlsm_add_cert_from_file( ctx, cacertfile, isca );
1450 if ( rc ) {
1451 errcode = PR_GetError();
1452 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1453 "TLS: %s is not a valid CA certificate file - error %d:%s.\n",
1454 cacertfile, errcode,
1455 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1456 /* failure with cacertfile is a hard failure even if cacertdir is
1457 also specified and contains valid CA cert files */
1458 status = PR_FAILURE;
1459 } else {
1460 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1461 "TLS: loaded CA certificate file %s.\n",
1462 cacertfile, 0, 0 );
1463 }
1464 }
1465
1466 /* if cacertfile above failed, we will return failure, even
1467 if there is a valid CA cert in cacertdir - but we still
1468 process cacertdir in case the user has enabled trace level
1469 debugging so they can see the processing for cacertdir too */
1470 /* any cacertdir failures are "soft" failures - if the user specifies
1471 no cert checking, then we allow the tls/ssl to continue, no matter
1472 what was specified for cacertdir, or the contents of the directory
1473 - this is different behavior than that of cacertfile */
1474 if ( cacertdir ) {
1475 PRFileInfo fi;
1476 PRDir *dir;
1477 PRDirEntry *entry;
1478 PRStatus fistatus = PR_FAILURE;
1479
1480 memset( &fi, 0, sizeof(fi) );
1481 fistatus = PR_GetFileInfo( cacertdir, &fi );
1482 if ( PR_SUCCESS != fistatus) {
1483 errcode = PR_GetError();
1484 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1485 "TLS: could not get info about the CA certificate directory %s - error %d:%s.\n",
1486 cacertdir, errcode,
1487 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1488 goto done;
1489 }
1490
1491 if ( fi.type != PR_FILE_DIRECTORY ) {
1492 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1493 "TLS: error: the CA certificate directory %s is not a directory.\n",
1494 cacertdir, 0 ,0 );
1495 goto done;
1496 }
1497
1498 dir = PR_OpenDir( cacertdir );
1499 if ( NULL == dir ) {
1500 errcode = PR_GetError();
1501 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1502 "TLS: could not open the CA certificate directory %s - error %d:%s.\n",
1503 cacertdir, errcode,
1504 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1505 goto done;
1506 }
1507
1508 do {
1509 entry = PR_ReadDir( dir, PR_SKIP_BOTH | PR_SKIP_HIDDEN );
1510 if ( ( NULL != entry ) && ( NULL != entry->name ) ) {
1511 char *fullpath = NULL;
1512 char *ptr;
1513
1514 ptr = PL_strrstr( entry->name, PEM_CA_HASH_FILE_SUFFIX );
1515 if ( ( ptr == NULL ) || ( *(ptr + PEM_CA_HASH_FILE_SUFFIX_LEN) != '\0' ) ) {
1516 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1517 "TLS: file %s does not end in [%s] - does not appear to be a CA certificate "
1518 "directory file with a properly hashed file name - skipping.\n",
1519 entry->name, PEM_CA_HASH_FILE_SUFFIX, 0 );
1520 continue;
1521 }
1522 fullpath = PR_smprintf( "%s/%s", cacertdir, entry->name );
1523 if ( !tlsm_add_cert_from_file( ctx, fullpath, isca ) ) {
1524 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1525 "TLS: loaded CA certificate file %s from CA certificate directory %s.\n",
1526 fullpath, cacertdir, 0 );
1527 } else {
1528 errcode = PR_GetError();
1529 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1530 "TLS: %s is not a valid CA certificate file - error %d:%s.\n",
1531 fullpath, errcode,
1532 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1533 }
1534 PR_smprintf_free( fullpath );
1535 }
1536 } while ( NULL != entry );
1537 PR_CloseDir( dir );
1538 }
1539done:
1540 if ( status != PR_SUCCESS ) {
1541 return -1;
1542 }
1543
1544 return 0;
1545}
1546
1547/*
1548 * NSS supports having multiple cert/key databases in the same
1549 * directory, each one having a unique string prefix e.g.
1550 * slapd-01-cert8.db - the prefix here is "slapd-01-"
1551 * this function examines the given certdir - if it looks like
1552 * /path/to/directory/prefix it will return the
1553 * /path/to/directory part in realcertdir, and the prefix in prefix
1554 */
1555static void
1556tlsm_get_certdb_prefix( const char *certdir, char **realcertdir, char **prefix )
1557{
1558 char sep = PR_GetDirectorySeparator();
1559 char *ptr = NULL;
1560 struct PRFileInfo prfi;
1561 PRStatus prc;
1562
1563 *realcertdir = (char *)certdir; /* default is the one passed in */
1564
1565 /* if certdir is not given, just return */
1566 if ( !certdir ) {
1567 return;
1568 }
1569
1570 prc = PR_GetFileInfo( certdir, &prfi );
1571 /* if certdir exists (file or directory) then it cannot specify a prefix */
1572 if ( prc == PR_SUCCESS ) {
1573 return;
1574 }
1575
1576 /* if certdir was given, and there is a '/' in certdir, see if there
1577 is anything after the last '/' - if so, assume it is the prefix */
1578 if ( ( ( ptr = strrchr( certdir, sep ) ) ) && *(ptr+1) ) {
1579 *realcertdir = PL_strndup( certdir, ptr-certdir );
1580 *prefix = PL_strdup( ptr+1 );
1581 }
1582
1583 return;
1584}
1585
1586/*
1587 * Currently mutiple MozNSS contexts share one certificate storage. When the
1588 * certdb is being opened, only new certificates are added to the storage.
1589 * When different databases are used, conflicting nicknames make the
1590 * certificate lookup by the nickname impossible. In addition a token
1591 * description might be prepended in certain conditions.
1592 *
1593 * In order to make the certificate lookup by nickname possible, we explicitly
1594 * open each database using SECMOD_OpenUserDB and assign it the token
1595 * description. The token description is generated using ctx->tc_unique value,
1596 * which is unique for each context.
1597 */
1598static PK11SlotInfo *
1599tlsm_init_open_certdb( tlsm_ctx *ctx, const char *dbdir, const char *prefix )
1600{
1601 PK11SlotInfo *slot = NULL;
1602 char *token_desc = NULL;
1603 char *config = NULL;
1604
1605 token_desc = PR_smprintf( TLSM_CERTDB_DESC_FMT, ctx->tc_unique );
1606 config = PR_smprintf( "configDir='%s' tokenDescription='%s' certPrefix='%s' keyPrefix='%s' flags=readOnly",
1607 dbdir, token_desc, prefix, prefix );
1608 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE, "TLS: certdb config: %s\n", config, 0, 0 );
1609
1610 slot = SECMOD_OpenUserDB( config );
1611 if ( !slot ) {
1612 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
1613 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE, "TLS: cannot open certdb '%s', error %d:%s\n", dbdir, errcode,
1614 PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
1615 }
1616
1617 if ( token_desc )
1618 PR_smprintf_free( token_desc );
1619 if ( config )
1620 PR_smprintf_free( config );
1621
1622 return slot;
1623}
1624
1625/*
1626 * This is the part of the init we defer until we get the
1627 * actual security configuration information. This is
1628 * only called once, protected by a PRCallOnce
1629 * NOTE: This must be done before the first call to SSL_ImportFD,
1630 * especially the setting of the policy
1631 * NOTE: This must be called after fork()
1632 */
1633static int
1634tlsm_deferred_init( void *arg )
1635{
1636 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)arg;
1637 struct ldaptls *lt = ctx->tc_config;
1638 const char *securitydirs[3];
1639 int ii;
1640 int nn;
1641 PRErrorCode errcode = 1;
1642#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
1643 NSSInitParameters initParams;
1644 NSSInitContext *initctx = NULL;
1645 PK11SlotInfo *certdb_slot = NULL;
1646#endif
1647 SECStatus rc;
1648 int done = 0;
1649
1650#ifdef HAVE_SECMOD_RESTARTMODULES
1651 /* NSS enforces the pkcs11 requirement that modules should be unloaded after
1652 a fork() - since there is no portable way to determine if NSS has been
1653 already initialized in a parent process, we just call SECMOD_RestartModules
1654 with force == FALSE - if the module has been unloaded due to a fork, it will
1655 be reloaded, otherwise, it is a no-op */
1656 if ( SECFailure == ( rc = SECMOD_RestartModules(PR_FALSE /* do not force */) ) ) {
1657 errcode = PORT_GetError();
1658 if ( errcode != SEC_ERROR_NOT_INITIALIZED ) {
1659 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1660 "TLS: could not restart the security modules: %d:%s\n",
1661 errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), 0 );
1662 } else {
1663 errcode = 1;
1664 }
1665 }
1666#endif
1667
1668#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
1669 memset( &initParams, 0, sizeof( initParams ) );
1670 initParams.length = sizeof( initParams );
1671#endif /* HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT */
1672
1673#ifdef LDAP_R_COMPILE
1674 if ( PR_CallOnce( &tlsm_init_mutex_callonce, tlsm_thr_init_callonce ) ) {
1675 return -1;
1676 }
1677#endif /* LDAP_R_COMPILE */
1678
1679#ifndef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
1680 if ( !NSS_IsInitialized() ) {
1681#endif /* HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT */
1682 /*
1683 MOZNSS_DIR will override everything else - you can
1684 always set MOZNSS_DIR to force the use of this
1685 directory
1686 If using MOZNSS, specify the location of the moznss db dir
1687 in the cacertdir directive of the OpenLDAP configuration.
1688 DEFAULT_MOZNSS_DIR will only be used if the code cannot
1689 find a security dir to use based on the current
1690 settings
1691 */
1692 nn = 0;
1693 securitydirs[nn++] = PR_GetEnv( "MOZNSS_DIR" );
1694 securitydirs[nn++] = lt->lt_cacertdir;
1695 securitydirs[nn++] = PR_GetEnv( "DEFAULT_MOZNSS_DIR" );
1696 for ( ii = 0; !done && ( ii < nn ); ++ii ) {
1697 char *realcertdir = NULL;
1698 const char *defprefix = "";
1699 char *prefix = (char *)defprefix;
1700 const char *securitydir = securitydirs[ii];
1701 if ( NULL == securitydir ) {
1702 continue;
1703 }
1704
1705 tlsm_get_certdb_prefix( securitydir, &realcertdir, &prefix );
1706
1707 /* initialize only moddb; certdb will be initialized explicitly */
1708#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
1709#ifdef INITCONTEXT_HACK
1710 if ( !NSS_IsInitialized() && ctx->tc_is_server ) {
1711 rc = NSS_Initialize( realcertdir, prefix, prefix, SECMOD_DB, NSS_INIT_READONLY );
1712 } else {
1713 initctx = NSS_InitContext( realcertdir, prefix, prefix, SECMOD_DB,
1714 &initParams, NSS_INIT_READONLY|NSS_INIT_NOCERTDB );
1715 }
1716#else
1717 initctx = NSS_InitContext( realcertdir, prefix, prefix, SECMOD_DB,
1718 &initParams, NSS_INIT_READONLY|NSS_INIT_NOCERTDB );
1719#endif
1720 rc = SECFailure;
1721
1722 if ( initctx != NULL ) {
1723 certdb_slot = tlsm_init_open_certdb( ctx, realcertdir, prefix );
1724 if ( certdb_slot ) {
1725 rc = SECSuccess;
1726 ctx->tc_initctx = initctx;
1727 ctx->tc_certdb_slot = certdb_slot;
1728 } else {
1729 NSS_ShutdownContext( initctx );
1730 initctx = NULL;
1731 }
1732 }
1733#else
1734 rc = NSS_Initialize( realcertdir, prefix, prefix, SECMOD_DB, NSS_INIT_READONLY );
1735#endif
1736
1737 if ( rc != SECSuccess ) {
1738 errcode = PORT_GetError();
1739 if ( securitydirs[ii] != lt->lt_cacertdir) {
1740 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1741 "TLS: could not initialize moznss using security dir %s prefix %s - error %d.\n",
1742 realcertdir, prefix, errcode );
1743 }
1744 } else {
1745 /* success */
1746 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE, "TLS: using moznss security dir %s prefix %s.\n",
1747 realcertdir, prefix, 0 );
1748 errcode = 0;
1749 done = 1;
1750 }
1751 if ( realcertdir != securitydir ) {
1752 PL_strfree( realcertdir );
1753 }
1754 if ( prefix != defprefix ) {
1755 PL_strfree( prefix );
1756 }
1757 }
1758
1759 if ( errcode ) { /* no moznss db found, or not using moznss db */
1760#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
1761 int flags = NSS_INIT_READONLY|NSS_INIT_NOCERTDB|NSS_INIT_NOMODDB;
1762#ifdef INITCONTEXT_HACK
1763 if ( !NSS_IsInitialized() && ctx->tc_is_server ) {
1764 rc = NSS_NoDB_Init( NULL );
1765 } else {
1766 initctx = NSS_InitContext( CERTDB_NONE, PREFIX_NONE, PREFIX_NONE, SECMOD_DB,
1767 &initParams, flags );
1768 rc = (initctx == NULL) ? SECFailure : SECSuccess;
1769 }
1770#else
1771 initctx = NSS_InitContext( CERTDB_NONE, PREFIX_NONE, PREFIX_NONE, SECMOD_DB,
1772 &initParams, flags );
1773 if ( initctx ) {
1774 ctx->tc_initctx = initctx;
1775 rc = SECSuccess;
1776 } else {
1777 rc = SECFailure;
1778 }
1779#endif
1780#else
1781 rc = NSS_NoDB_Init( NULL );
1782#endif
1783 if ( rc != SECSuccess ) {
1784 errcode = PORT_GetError();
1785 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1786 "TLS: could not initialize moznss - error %d:%s.\n",
1787 errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), 0 );
1788 return -1;
1789 }
1790 }
1791
1792 if ( errcode || lt->lt_cacertfile ) {
1793 /* initialize the PEM module */
1794 if ( tlsm_init_pem_module() ) {
1795 int pem_errcode = PORT_GetError();
1796 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1797 "TLS: could not initialize moznss PEM module - error %d:%s.\n",
1798 pem_errcode, PR_ErrorToString( pem_errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), 0 );
1799
1800 if ( errcode ) /* PEM is required */
1801 return -1;
1802
1803 } else if ( !errcode ) {
1804 tlsm_init_ca_certs( ctx, lt->lt_cacertfile, NULL );
1805 }
1806 }
1807
1808 if ( errcode ) {
1809 if ( tlsm_init_ca_certs( ctx, lt->lt_cacertfile, lt->lt_cacertdir ) ) {
1810 /* if we tried to use lt->lt_cacertdir as an NSS key/cert db, errcode
1811 will be a value other than 1 - print an error message so that the
1812 user will know that failed too */
1813 if ( ( errcode != 1 ) && ( lt->lt_cacertdir ) ) {
1814 char *realcertdir = NULL;
1815 char *prefix = NULL;
1816 tlsm_get_certdb_prefix( lt->lt_cacertdir, &realcertdir, &prefix );
1817 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
1818 "TLS: could not initialize moznss using security dir %s prefix %s - error %d.\n",
1819 realcertdir, prefix ? prefix : "", errcode );
1820 if ( realcertdir != lt->lt_cacertdir ) {
1821 PL_strfree( realcertdir );
1822 }
1823 PL_strfree( prefix );
1824 }
1825 return -1;
1826 }
1827
1828 ctx->tc_using_pem = PR_TRUE;
1829 }
1830
1831 NSS_SetDomesticPolicy();
1832
1833 PK11_SetPasswordFunc( tlsm_pin_prompt );
1834
1835 /* register cleanup function */
1836 if ( tlsm_register_nss_shutdown() ) {
1837 errcode = PORT_GetError();
1838 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1839 "TLS: could not register NSS shutdown function: %d:%s\n",
1840 errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), 0 );
1841 return -1;
1842 }
1843
1844 if ( ctx->tc_is_server ) {
1845 /* 0 means use the defaults here */
1846 SSL_ConfigServerSessionIDCache( 0, 0, 0, NULL );
1847 }
1848
1849#ifndef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
1850 }
1851#endif /* HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT */
1852
1853 return 0;
1854}
1855
1856/*
1857 * Find and verify the certificate.
1858 * The key is loaded and stored in ctx->tc_private_key
1859 */
1860static int
1861tlsm_find_and_verify_cert_key( tlsm_ctx *ctx )
1862{
1863 SECCertificateUsage certUsage;
1864 PRBool checkSig;
1865 SECStatus status;
1866 void *pin_arg;
1867
1868 if ( tlsm_ctx_load_private_key( ctx ) )
1869 return -1;
1870
1871 pin_arg = SSL_RevealPinArg( ctx->tc_model );
1872 certUsage = ctx->tc_is_server ? certificateUsageSSLServer : certificateUsageSSLClient;
1873 checkSig = ctx->tc_verify_cert ? PR_TRUE : PR_FALSE;
1874
1875 status = tlsm_verify_cert( ctx->tc_certdb, ctx->tc_certificate, pin_arg,
1876 checkSig, certUsage, ctx->tc_warn_only, PR_TRUE );
1877
1878 return status == SECSuccess ? 0 : -1;
1879}
1880
1881static int
1882tlsm_get_client_auth_data( void *arg, PRFileDesc *fd,
1883 CERTDistNames *caNames, CERTCertificate **pRetCert,
1884 SECKEYPrivateKey **pRetKey )
1885{
1886 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)arg;
1887
1888 if ( pRetCert )
1889 *pRetCert = CERT_DupCertificate( ctx->tc_certificate );
1890
1891 if ( pRetKey )
1892 *pRetKey = SECKEY_CopyPrivateKey( ctx->tc_private_key );
1893
1894 return SECSuccess;
1895}
1896
1897/*
1898 * ctx must have a tc_model that is valid
1899*/
1900static int
1901tlsm_clientauth_init( tlsm_ctx *ctx )
1902{
1903 SECStatus status = SECFailure;
1904 int rc;
1905 PRBool saveval;
1906
1907 saveval = ctx->tc_warn_only;
1908 ctx->tc_warn_only = PR_TRUE;
1909 rc = tlsm_find_and_verify_cert_key(ctx);
1910 ctx->tc_warn_only = saveval;
1911 if ( rc ) {
1912 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
1913 "TLS: error: unable to set up client certificate authentication for "
1914 "certificate named %s\n", tlsm_ctx_subject_name(ctx), 0, 0 );
1915 return -1;
1916 }
1917
1918 status = SSL_GetClientAuthDataHook( ctx->tc_model,
1919 tlsm_get_client_auth_data,
1920 (void *)ctx );
1921
1922 return ( status == SECSuccess ? 0 : -1 );
1923}
1924
1925/*
1926 * Tear down the TLS subsystem. Should only be called once.
1927 */
1928static void
1929tlsm_destroy( void )
1930{
1931#ifdef LDAP_R_COMPILE
1932 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy( &tlsm_ctx_count_mutex );
1933 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy( &tlsm_init_mutex );
1934 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy( &tlsm_pem_mutex );
1935#endif
1936}
1937
1938static struct ldaptls *
1939tlsm_copy_config ( const struct ldaptls *config )
1940{
1941 struct ldaptls *copy;
1942
1943 assert( config );
1944
1945 copy = LDAP_MALLOC( sizeof( *copy ) );
1946 if ( !copy )
1947 return NULL;
1948
1949 memset( copy, 0, sizeof( *copy ) );
1950
1951 if ( config->lt_certfile )
1952 copy->lt_certfile = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_certfile );
1953 if ( config->lt_keyfile )
1954 copy->lt_keyfile = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_keyfile );
1955 if ( config->lt_dhfile )
1956 copy->lt_dhfile = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_dhfile );
1957 if ( config->lt_cacertfile )
1958 copy->lt_cacertfile = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_cacertfile );
1959 if ( config->lt_cacertdir )
1960 copy->lt_cacertdir = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_cacertdir );
1961 if ( config->lt_ciphersuite )
1962 copy->lt_ciphersuite = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_ciphersuite );
1963 if ( config->lt_crlfile )
1964 copy->lt_crlfile = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_crlfile );
1965 if ( config->lt_randfile )
1966 copy->lt_randfile = LDAP_STRDUP( config->lt_randfile );
1967
1968 copy->lt_protocol_min = config->lt_protocol_min;
1969
1970 return copy;
1971}
1972
1973static void
1974tlsm_free_config ( struct ldaptls *config )
1975{
1976 assert( config );
1977
1978 if ( config->lt_certfile )
1979 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_certfile );
1980 if ( config->lt_keyfile )
1981 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_keyfile );
1982 if ( config->lt_dhfile )
1983 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_dhfile );
1984 if ( config->lt_cacertfile )
1985 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_cacertfile );
1986 if ( config->lt_cacertdir )
1987 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_cacertdir );
1988 if ( config->lt_ciphersuite )
1989 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_ciphersuite );
1990 if ( config->lt_crlfile )
1991 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_crlfile );
1992 if ( config->lt_randfile )
1993 LDAP_FREE( config->lt_randfile );
1994
1995 LDAP_FREE( config );
1996}
1997
1998static tls_ctx *
1999tlsm_ctx_new ( struct ldapoptions *lo )
2000{
2001 tlsm_ctx *ctx;
2002
2003 ctx = LDAP_MALLOC( sizeof (*ctx) );
2004 if ( ctx ) {
2005 ctx->tc_refcnt = 1;
2006#ifdef LDAP_R_COMPILE
2007 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_init( &ctx->tc_refmutex );
2008#endif
2009 LDAP_MUTEX_LOCK( &tlsm_ctx_count_mutex );
2010 ctx->tc_unique = tlsm_ctx_count++;
2011 LDAP_MUTEX_UNLOCK( &tlsm_ctx_count_mutex );
2012 ctx->tc_config = NULL; /* populated later by tlsm_ctx_init */
2013 ctx->tc_certdb = NULL;
2014 ctx->tc_certdb_slot = NULL;
2015 ctx->tc_certificate = NULL;
2016 ctx->tc_private_key = NULL;
2017 ctx->tc_pin_file = NULL;
2018 ctx->tc_model = NULL;
2019 memset(&ctx->tc_callonce, 0, sizeof(ctx->tc_callonce));
2020 ctx->tc_require_cert = lo->ldo_tls_require_cert;
2021 ctx->tc_verify_cert = PR_FALSE;
2022 ctx->tc_using_pem = PR_FALSE;
2023#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
2024 ctx->tc_initctx = NULL;
2025#endif /* HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT */
2026 ctx->tc_pem_objs = NULL;
2027 ctx->tc_n_pem_objs = 0;
2028 ctx->tc_warn_only = PR_FALSE;
2029 }
2030 return (tls_ctx *)ctx;
2031}
2032
2033static void
2034tlsm_ctx_ref( tls_ctx *ctx )
2035{
2036 tlsm_ctx *c = (tlsm_ctx *)ctx;
2037 LDAP_MUTEX_LOCK( &c->tc_refmutex );
2038 c->tc_refcnt++;
2039 LDAP_MUTEX_UNLOCK( &c->tc_refmutex );
2040}
2041
2042static void
2043tlsm_ctx_free ( tls_ctx *ctx )
2044{
2045 tlsm_ctx *c = (tlsm_ctx *)ctx;
2046 int refcount;
2047
2048 if ( !c ) return;
2049
2050 LDAP_MUTEX_LOCK( &c->tc_refmutex );
2051 refcount = --c->tc_refcnt;
2052 LDAP_MUTEX_UNLOCK( &c->tc_refmutex );
2053 if ( refcount )
2054 return;
2055
2056 LDAP_MUTEX_LOCK( &tlsm_init_mutex );
2057 if ( c->tc_model )
2058 PR_Close( c->tc_model );
2059 if ( c->tc_certificate )
2060 CERT_DestroyCertificate( c->tc_certificate );
2061 if ( c->tc_private_key )
2062 SECKEY_DestroyPrivateKey( c->tc_private_key );
2063 c->tc_certdb = NULL; /* if not the default, may have to clean up */
2064 if ( c->tc_certdb_slot ) {
2065 if ( SECMOD_CloseUserDB( c->tc_certdb_slot ) ) {
2066 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
2067 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2068 "TLS: could not close certdb slot - error %d:%s.\n",
2069 errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), 0 );
2070 }
2071 }
2072 if ( c->tc_pin_file ) {
2073 PL_strfree( c->tc_pin_file );
2074 c->tc_pin_file = NULL;
2075 }
2076 tlsm_free_pem_objs( c );
2077#ifdef HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT
2078 if ( c->tc_initctx ) {
2079 if ( NSS_ShutdownContext( c->tc_initctx ) ) {
2080 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
2081 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2082 "TLS: could not shutdown NSS - error %d:%s.\n",
2083 errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), 0 );
2084 }
2085 }
2086 c->tc_initctx = NULL;
2087#endif /* HAVE_NSS_INITCONTEXT */
2088 LDAP_MUTEX_UNLOCK( &tlsm_init_mutex );
2089#ifdef LDAP_R_COMPILE
2090 ldap_pvt_thread_mutex_destroy( &c->tc_refmutex );
2091#endif
2092
2093 if ( c->tc_config )
2094 tlsm_free_config( c->tc_config );
2095
2096 LDAP_FREE( c );
2097}
2098
2099/*
2100 * initialize a new TLS context
2101 */
2102static int
2103tlsm_ctx_init( struct ldapoptions *lo, struct ldaptls *lt, int is_server )
2104{
2105 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)lo->ldo_tls_ctx;
2106 ctx->tc_config = tlsm_copy_config( lt );
2107 ctx->tc_is_server = is_server;
2108
2109 return 0;
2110}
2111
2112/* returns true if the given string looks like
2113 "tokenname" ":" "certnickname"
2114 This is true if there is a ':' colon character
2115 in the string and the colon is not the first
2116 or the last character in the string
2117*/
2118static int
2119tlsm_is_tokenname_certnick( const char *certfile )
2120{
2121 if ( certfile ) {
2122 const char *ptr = PL_strchr( certfile, ':' );
2123 return ptr && (ptr != certfile) && (*(ptr+1));
2124 }
2125 return 0;
2126}
2127
2128static int
2129tlsm_deferred_ctx_init( void *arg )
2130{
2131 tlsm_ctx *ctx = (tlsm_ctx *)arg;
2132 PRBool sslv2 = PR_FALSE;
2133 PRBool sslv3 = PR_TRUE;
2134 PRBool tlsv1 = PR_TRUE;
2135 PRBool request_cert = PR_FALSE;
2136 PRInt32 require_cert = PR_FALSE;
2137 PRFileDesc *fd;
2138 struct ldaptls *lt;
2139
2140 if ( tlsm_deferred_init( ctx ) ) {
2141 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2142 "TLS: could not perform TLS system initialization.\n",
2143 0, 0, 0 );
2144 return -1;
2145 }
2146
2147 ctx->tc_certdb = CERT_GetDefaultCertDB(); /* If there is ever a per-context db, change this */
2148
2149 fd = PR_CreateIOLayerStub( tlsm_layer_id, &tlsm_PR_methods );
2150 if ( fd ) {
2151 ctx->tc_model = SSL_ImportFD( NULL, fd );
2152 }
2153
2154 if ( !ctx->tc_model ) {
2155 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2156 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2157 "TLS: could perform TLS socket I/O layer initialization - error %d:%s.\n",
2158 err, PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), NULL );
2159
2160 if ( fd ) {
2161 PR_Close( fd );
2162 }
2163 return -1;
2164 }
2165
2166 if ( SSL_SetPKCS11PinArg(ctx->tc_model, ctx) ) {
2167 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2168 "TLS: could not set pin prompt argument\n", 0, 0, 0);
2169 return -1;
2170 }
2171
2172 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_SECURITY, PR_TRUE ) ) {
2173 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2174 "TLS: could not set secure mode on.\n",
2175 0, 0, 0 );
2176 return -1;
2177 }
2178
2179 lt = ctx->tc_config;
2180
2181 /* default is sslv3 and tlsv1 */
2182 if ( lt->lt_protocol_min ) {
2183 if ( lt->lt_protocol_min > LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_PROTOCOL_SSL3 ) {
2184 sslv3 = PR_FALSE;
2185 } else if ( lt->lt_protocol_min <= LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_PROTOCOL_SSL2 ) {
2186 sslv2 = PR_TRUE;
2187 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2188 "TLS: warning: minimum TLS protocol level set to "
2189 "include SSLv2 - SSLv2 is insecure - do not use\n", 0, 0, 0 );
2190 }
2191 }
2192 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_ENABLE_SSL2, sslv2 ) ) {
2193 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2194 "TLS: could not set SSLv2 mode on.\n",
2195 0, 0, 0 );
2196 return -1;
2197 }
2198 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_ENABLE_SSL3, sslv3 ) ) {
2199 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2200 "TLS: could not set SSLv3 mode on.\n",
2201 0, 0, 0 );
2202 return -1;
2203 }
2204 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_ENABLE_TLS, tlsv1 ) ) {
2205 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2206 "TLS: could not set TLSv1 mode on.\n",
2207 0, 0, 0 );
2208 return -1;
2209 }
2210
2211 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_HANDSHAKE_AS_CLIENT, !ctx->tc_is_server ) ) {
2212 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2213 "TLS: could not set handshake as client.\n",
2214 0, 0, 0 );
2215 return -1;
2216 }
2217 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_HANDSHAKE_AS_SERVER, ctx->tc_is_server ) ) {
2218 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2219 "TLS: could not set handshake as server.\n",
2220 0, 0, 0 );
2221 return -1;
2222 }
2223
2224 if ( lt->lt_ciphersuite ) {
2225 if ( tlsm_parse_ciphers( ctx, lt->lt_ciphersuite ) ) {
2226 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2227 "TLS: could not set cipher list %s.\n",
2228 lt->lt_ciphersuite, 0, 0 );
2229 return -1;
2230 }
2231 } else if ( tlsm_parse_ciphers( ctx, "DEFAULT" ) ) {
2232 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2233 "TLS: could not set cipher list DEFAULT.\n",
2234 0, 0, 0 );
2235 return -1;
2236 }
2237
2238 if ( !ctx->tc_require_cert ) {
2239 ctx->tc_verify_cert = PR_FALSE;
2240 } else if ( !ctx->tc_is_server ) {
2241 request_cert = PR_TRUE;
2242 require_cert = SSL_REQUIRE_NO_ERROR;
2243 if ( ctx->tc_require_cert == LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_DEMAND ||
2244 ctx->tc_require_cert == LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_HARD ) {
2245 require_cert = SSL_REQUIRE_ALWAYS;
2246 }
2247 if ( ctx->tc_require_cert != LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_ALLOW )
2248 ctx->tc_verify_cert = PR_TRUE;
2249 } else { /* server */
2250 /* server does not request certs by default */
2251 /* if allow - client may send cert, server will ignore if errors */
2252 /* if try - client may send cert, server will error if bad cert */
2253 /* if hard or demand - client must send cert, server will error if bad cert */
2254 request_cert = PR_TRUE;
2255 require_cert = SSL_REQUIRE_NO_ERROR;
2256 if ( ctx->tc_require_cert == LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_DEMAND ||
2257 ctx->tc_require_cert == LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_HARD ) {
2258 require_cert = SSL_REQUIRE_ALWAYS;
2259 }
2260 if ( ctx->tc_require_cert != LDAP_OPT_X_TLS_ALLOW ) {
2261 ctx->tc_verify_cert = PR_TRUE;
2262 } else {
2263 ctx->tc_warn_only = PR_TRUE;
2264 }
2265 }
2266
2267 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_REQUEST_CERTIFICATE, request_cert ) ) {
2268 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2269 "TLS: could not set request certificate mode.\n",
2270 0, 0, 0 );
2271 return -1;
2272 }
2273
2274 if ( SECSuccess != SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_REQUIRE_CERTIFICATE, require_cert ) ) {
2275 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2276 "TLS: could not set require certificate mode.\n",
2277 0, 0, 0 );
2278 return -1;
2279 }
2280
2281 /* set up our cert and key, if any */
2282 if ( lt->lt_certfile ) {
2283 /* if using the PEM module, load the PEM file specified by lt_certfile */
2284 /* otherwise, assume this is the name of a cert already in the db */
2285 if ( ctx->tc_using_pem ) {
2286 /* this sets ctx->tc_certificate to the correct value */
2287 int rc = tlsm_add_cert_from_file( ctx, lt->lt_certfile, PR_FALSE );
2288 if ( rc ) {
2289 return rc;
2290 }
2291 } else {
2292 char *tmp_certname;
2293
2294 if ( tlsm_is_tokenname_certnick( lt->lt_certfile )) {
2295 /* assume already in form tokenname:certnickname */
2296 tmp_certname = PL_strdup( lt->lt_certfile );
2297 } else if ( ctx->tc_certdb_slot ) {
2298 tmp_certname = PR_smprintf( TLSM_CERTDB_DESC_FMT ":%s", ctx->tc_unique, lt->lt_certfile );
2299 } else {
2300 tmp_certname = PR_smprintf( "%s", lt->lt_certfile );
2301 }
2302
2303 ctx->tc_certificate = PK11_FindCertFromNickname( tmp_certname, SSL_RevealPinArg( ctx->tc_model ) );
2304 PR_smprintf_free( tmp_certname );
2305
2306 if ( !ctx->tc_certificate ) {
2307 PRErrorCode errcode = PR_GetError();
2308 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2309 "TLS: error: the certificate '%s' could not be found in the database - error %d:%s.\n",
2310 lt->lt_certfile, errcode, PR_ErrorToString( errcode, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
2311 return -1;
2312 }
2313 }
2314 }
2315
2316 if ( lt->lt_keyfile ) {
2317 /* if using the PEM module, load the PEM file specified by lt_keyfile */
2318 /* otherwise, assume this is the pininfo for the key */
2319 if ( ctx->tc_using_pem ) {
2320 int rc = tlsm_add_key_from_file( ctx, lt->lt_keyfile );
2321 if ( rc ) {
2322 return rc;
2323 }
2324 } else {
2325 if ( ctx->tc_pin_file )
2326 PL_strfree( ctx->tc_pin_file );
2327 ctx->tc_pin_file = PL_strdup( lt->lt_keyfile );
2328 }
2329 }
2330
2331 /* Set up callbacks for use by clients */
2332 if ( !ctx->tc_is_server ) {
2333 if ( SSL_OptionSet( ctx->tc_model, SSL_NO_CACHE, PR_TRUE ) != SECSuccess ) {
2334 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2335 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2336 "TLS: error: could not set nocache option for moznss - error %d:%s\n",
2337 err, PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), NULL );
2338 return -1;
2339 }
2340
2341 if ( SSL_BadCertHook( ctx->tc_model, tlsm_bad_cert_handler, ctx ) != SECSuccess ) {
2342 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2343 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2344 "TLS: error: could not set bad cert handler for moznss - error %d:%s\n",
2345 err, PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), NULL );
2346 return -1;
2347 }
2348
2349 /*
2350 since a cert has been specified, assume the client wants to do cert auth
2351 */
2352 if ( ctx->tc_certificate ) {
2353 if ( tlsm_clientauth_init( ctx ) ) {
2354 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2355 "TLS: error: unable to set up client certificate authentication using '%s'\n",
2356 tlsm_ctx_subject_name(ctx), 0, 0 );
2357 return -1;
2358 }
2359 }
2360 } else { /* set up secure server */
2361 SSLKEAType certKEA;
2362 SECStatus status;
2363
2364 /* must have a certificate for the server to use */
2365 if ( !ctx->tc_certificate ) {
2366 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2367 "TLS: error: no server certificate: must specify a certificate for the server to use\n",
2368 0, 0, 0 );
2369 return -1;
2370 }
2371
2372 if ( tlsm_find_and_verify_cert_key( ctx ) ) {
2373 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2374 "TLS: error: unable to find and verify server's cert and key for certificate %s\n",
2375 tlsm_ctx_subject_name(ctx), 0, 0 );
2376 return -1;
2377 }
2378
2379 /* configure the socket to be a secure server socket */
2380 certKEA = NSS_FindCertKEAType( ctx->tc_certificate );
2381 status = SSL_ConfigSecureServer( ctx->tc_model, ctx->tc_certificate, ctx->tc_private_key, certKEA );
2382
2383 if ( SECSuccess != status ) {
2384 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2385 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2386 "TLS: error: unable to configure secure server using certificate '%s' - error %d:%s\n",
2387 tlsm_ctx_subject_name(ctx), err, PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
2388 return -1;
2389 }
2390 }
2391
2392 /* Callback for authenticating certificate */
2393 if ( SSL_AuthCertificateHook( ctx->tc_model, tlsm_auth_cert_handler,
2394 ctx ) != SECSuccess ) {
2395 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2396 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2397 "TLS: error: could not set auth cert handler for moznss - error %d:%s\n",
2398 err, PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), NULL );
2399 return -1;
2400 }
2401
2402 if ( SSL_HandshakeCallback( ctx->tc_model, tlsm_handshake_complete_cb, ctx ) ) {
2403 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2404 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2405 "TLS: error: could not set handshake callback for moznss - error %d:%s\n",
2406 err, PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ), NULL );
2407 return -1;
2408 }
2409
2410 tlsm_free_config( ctx->tc_config );
2411 ctx->tc_config = NULL;
2412
2413 return 0;
2414}
2415
2416struct tls_data {
2417 tlsm_session *session;
2418 Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod;
2419 /* there seems to be no portable way to determine if the
2420 sockbuf sd has been set to nonblocking mode - the
2421 call to ber_pvt_socket_set_nonblock() takes place
2422 before the tls socket is set up, so we cannot
2423 intercept that call either.
2424 On systems where fcntl is available, we can just
2425 F_GETFL and test for O_NONBLOCK. On other systems,
2426 we will just see if the IO op returns EAGAIN or EWOULDBLOCK,
2427 and just set this flag */
2428 PRBool nonblock;
2429 /*
2430 * NSS tries hard to be backwards compatible with SSLv2 clients, or
2431 * clients that send an SSLv2 client hello. This message is not
2432 * tagged in any way, so NSS has no way to know if the incoming
2433 * message is a valid SSLv2 client hello or just some bogus data
2434 * (or cleartext LDAP). We store the first byte read from the
2435 * client here. The most common case will be a client sending
2436 * LDAP data instead of SSL encrypted LDAP data. This can happen,
2437 * for example, if using ldapsearch -Z - if the starttls fails,
2438 * the client will fallback to plain cleartext LDAP. So if we
2439 * see that the firstbyte is a valid LDAP tag, we can be
2440 * pretty sure this is happening.
2441 */
2442 ber_tag_t firsttag;
2443 /*
2444 * NSS doesn't return SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ, SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE, etc.
2445 * when it is blocked, so we have to set a flag in the wrapped send
2446 * and recv calls that tells us what operation NSS was last blocked
2447 * on
2448 */
2449#define TLSM_READ 1
2450#define TLSM_WRITE 2
2451 int io_flag;
2452};
2453
2454static struct tls_data *
2455tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( PRFileDesc *fd )
2456{
2457 struct tls_data *p;
2458 PRFileDesc *myfd;
2459
2460 if ( !fd ) {
2461 return NULL;
2462 }
2463
2464 myfd = PR_GetIdentitiesLayer( fd, tlsm_layer_id );
2465
2466 if ( !myfd ) {
2467 return NULL;
2468 }
2469
2470 p = (struct tls_data *)myfd->secret;
2471
2472 return p;
2473}
2474
2475static int
2476tlsm_is_non_ssl_message( PRFileDesc *fd, ber_tag_t *thebyte )
2477{
2478 struct tls_data *p;
2479
2480 if ( thebyte ) {
2481 *thebyte = LBER_DEFAULT;
2482 }
2483
2484 p = tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( fd );
2485 if ( p == NULL || p->sbiod == NULL ) {
2486 return 0;
2487 }
2488
2489 if ( p->firsttag == LBER_SEQUENCE ) {
2490 if ( thebyte ) {
2491 *thebyte = p->firsttag;
2492 }
2493 return 1;
2494 }
2495
2496 return 0;
2497}
2498
2499static tls_session *
2500tlsm_session_new ( tls_ctx * ctx, int is_server )
2501{
2502 tlsm_ctx *c = (tlsm_ctx *)ctx;
2503 tlsm_session *session;
2504 PRFileDesc *fd;
2505 PRStatus status;
2506 int rc;
2507
2508 c->tc_is_server = is_server;
2509 LDAP_MUTEX_LOCK( &tlsm_init_mutex );
2510 status = PR_CallOnceWithArg( &c->tc_callonce, tlsm_deferred_ctx_init, c );
2511 LDAP_MUTEX_UNLOCK( &tlsm_init_mutex );
2512 if ( PR_SUCCESS != status ) {
2513 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2514 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2515 "TLS: error: could not initialize moznss security context - error %d:%s\n",
2516 err, PR_ErrorToString(err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT), NULL );
2517 return NULL;
2518 }
2519
2520 fd = PR_CreateIOLayerStub( tlsm_layer_id, &tlsm_PR_methods );
2521 if ( !fd ) {
2522 return NULL;
2523 }
2524
2525 session = SSL_ImportFD( c->tc_model, fd );
2526 if ( !session ) {
2527 PR_DELETE( fd );
2528 return NULL;
2529 }
2530
2531 rc = SSL_ResetHandshake( session, is_server );
2532 if ( rc ) {
2533 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2534 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
2535 "TLS: error: new session - reset handshake failure %d - error %d:%s\n",
2536 rc, err,
2537 err ? PR_ErrorToString( err, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) : "unknown" );
2538 PR_DELETE( fd );
2539 PR_Close( session );
2540 session = NULL;
2541 }
2542
2543 return (tls_session *)session;
2544}
2545
2546static int
2547tlsm_session_accept_or_connect( tls_session *session, int is_accept )
2548{
2549 tlsm_session *s = (tlsm_session *)session;
2550 int rc;
2551 const char *op = is_accept ? "accept" : "connect";
2552
2553 if ( pem_module ) {
2554 LDAP_MUTEX_LOCK( &tlsm_pem_mutex );
2555 }
2556 rc = SSL_ForceHandshake( s );
2557 if ( pem_module ) {
2558 LDAP_MUTEX_UNLOCK( &tlsm_pem_mutex );
2559 }
2560 if ( rc ) {
2561 PRErrorCode err = PR_GetError();
2562 rc = -1;
2563 if ( err == PR_WOULD_BLOCK_ERROR ) {
2564 ber_tag_t thetag = LBER_DEFAULT;
2565 /* see if we are blocked because of a bogus packet */
2566 if ( tlsm_is_non_ssl_message( s, &thetag ) ) { /* see if we received a non-SSL message */
2567 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2568 "TLS: error: %s - error - received non-SSL message [0x%x]\n",
2569 op, (unsigned int)thetag, 0 );
2570 /* reset error to something more descriptive */
2571 PR_SetError( SSL_ERROR_RX_MALFORMED_HELLO_REQUEST, EPROTO );
2572 }
2573 } else {
2574 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2575 "TLS: error: %s - force handshake failure: errno %d - moznss error %d\n",
2576 op, errno, err );
2577 }
2578 }
2579
2580 return rc;
2581}
2582static int
2583tlsm_session_accept( tls_session *session )
2584{
2585 return tlsm_session_accept_or_connect( session, 1 );
2586}
2587
2588static int
2589tlsm_session_connect( LDAP *ld, tls_session *session )
2590{
2591 return tlsm_session_accept_or_connect( session, 0 );
2592}
2593
2594static int
2595tlsm_session_upflags( Sockbuf *sb, tls_session *session, int rc )
2596{
2597 int prerror = PR_GetError();
2598
2599 if ( ( prerror == PR_PENDING_INTERRUPT_ERROR ) || ( prerror == PR_WOULD_BLOCK_ERROR ) ) {
2600 tlsm_session *s = (tlsm_session *)session;
2601 struct tls_data *p = tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( s );
2602
2603 if ( p && ( p->io_flag == TLSM_READ ) ) {
2604 sb->sb_trans_needs_read = 1;
2605 return 1;
2606 } else if ( p && ( p->io_flag == TLSM_WRITE ) ) {
2607 sb->sb_trans_needs_write = 1;
2608 return 1;
2609 }
2610 }
2611
2612 return 0;
2613}
2614
2615static char *
2616tlsm_session_errmsg( tls_session *sess, int rc, char *buf, size_t len )
2617{
2618 int i;
2619 int prerror = PR_GetError();
2620
2621 i = PR_GetErrorTextLength();
2622 if ( i > len ) {
2623 char *msg = LDAP_MALLOC( i+1 );
2624 PR_GetErrorText( msg );
2625 memcpy( buf, msg, len );
2626 LDAP_FREE( msg );
2627 } else if ( i ) {
2628 PR_GetErrorText( buf );
2629 } else if ( prerror ) {
2630 i = PR_snprintf( buf, len, "TLS error %d:%s",
2631 prerror, PR_ErrorToString( prerror, PR_LANGUAGE_I_DEFAULT ) );
2632 }
2633
2634 return ( i > 0 ) ? buf : NULL;
2635}
2636
2637static int
2638tlsm_session_my_dn( tls_session *session, struct berval *der_dn )
2639{
2640 tlsm_session *s = (tlsm_session *)session;
2641 CERTCertificate *cert;
2642
2643 cert = SSL_LocalCertificate( s );
2644 if (!cert) return LDAP_INVALID_CREDENTIALS;
2645
2646 der_dn->bv_val = (char *)cert->derSubject.data;
2647 der_dn->bv_len = cert->derSubject.len;
2648 CERT_DestroyCertificate( cert );
2649 return 0;
2650}
2651
2652static int
2653tlsm_session_peer_dn( tls_session *session, struct berval *der_dn )
2654{
2655 tlsm_session *s = (tlsm_session *)session;
2656 CERTCertificate *cert;
2657
2658 cert = SSL_PeerCertificate( s );
2659 if (!cert) return LDAP_INVALID_CREDENTIALS;
2660
2661 der_dn->bv_val = (char *)cert->derSubject.data;
2662 der_dn->bv_len = cert->derSubject.len;
2663 CERT_DestroyCertificate( cert );
2664 return 0;
2665}
2666
2667/* what kind of hostname were we given? */
2668#define IS_DNS 0
2669#define IS_IP4 1
2670#define IS_IP6 2
2671
2672static int
2673tlsm_session_chkhost( LDAP *ld, tls_session *session, const char *name_in )
2674{
2675 tlsm_session *s = (tlsm_session *)session;
2676 CERTCertificate *cert;
2677 const char *name, *domain = NULL, *ptr;
2678 int ret, ntype = IS_DNS, nlen, dlen;
2679#ifdef LDAP_PF_INET6
2680 struct in6_addr addr;
2681#else
2682 struct in_addr addr;
2683#endif
2684 SECItem altname;
2685 SECStatus rv;
2686
2687 if( ldap_int_hostname &&
2688 ( !name_in || !strcasecmp( name_in, "localhost" ) ) )
2689 {
2690 name = ldap_int_hostname;
2691 } else {
2692 name = name_in;
2693 }
2694 nlen = strlen( name );
2695
2696 cert = SSL_PeerCertificate( s );
2697 if (!cert) {
2698 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY,
2699 "TLS: unable to get peer certificate.\n",
2700 0, 0, 0 );
2701 /* if this was a fatal condition, things would have
2702 * aborted long before now.
2703 */
2704 return LDAP_SUCCESS;
2705 }
2706
2707#ifdef LDAP_PF_INET6
2708 if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, name, &addr)) {
2709 ntype = IS_IP6;
2710 } else
2711#endif
2712 if ((ptr = strrchr(name, '.')) && isdigit((unsigned char)ptr[1])) {
2713 if (inet_aton(name, (struct in_addr *)&addr)) ntype = IS_IP4;
2714 }
2715 if (ntype == IS_DNS ) {
