2716 domain = strchr( name, '.' );
2717 if ( domain )
2718 dlen = nlen - ( domain - name );
2719 }
2720
2721 ret = LDAP_LOCAL_ERROR;
2722
2723 rv = CERT_FindCertExtension( cert, SEC_OID_X509_SUBJECT_ALT_NAME,
2724 &altname );
2725 if ( rv == SECSuccess && altname.data ) {
2726 PRArenaPool *arena;
2727 CERTGeneralName *names, *cur;
2728
2729 arena = PORT_NewArena(DER_DEFAULT_CHUNKSIZE);
2730 if ( !arena ) {
2731 ret = LDAP_NO_MEMORY;
2732 goto fail;
2733 }
2734
2735 names = cur = CERT_DecodeAltNameExtension(arena, &altname);
2736 if ( !cur )
2737 goto altfail;
2738
2739 do {
2740 char *host;
2741 int hlen;
2742
2743 /* ignore empty */
2744 if ( !cur->name.other.len ) continue;
2745
2746 host = (char *)cur->name.other.data;
2747 hlen = cur->name.other.len;
2748
2749 if ( cur->type == certDNSName ) {
2750 if ( ntype != IS_DNS ) continue;
2751
2752 /* is this an exact match? */
2753 if ( nlen == hlen && !strncasecmp( name, host, nlen )) {
2754 ret = LDAP_SUCCESS;
2755 break;
2756 }
2757
2758 /* is this a wildcard match? */
2759 if ( domain && host[0] == '*' && host[1] == '.' &&
2760 dlen == hlen-1 && !strncasecmp( domain, host+1, dlen )) {
2761 ret = LDAP_SUCCESS;
2762 break;
2763 }
2764 } else if ( cur->type == certIPAddress ) {
2765 if ( ntype == IS_DNS ) continue;
2766
2767#ifdef LDAP_PF_INET6
2768 if (ntype == IS_IP6 && hlen != sizeof(struct in6_addr)) {
2769 continue;
2770 } else
2771#endif
2772 if (ntype == IS_IP4 && hlen != sizeof(struct in_addr)) {
2773 continue;
2774 }
2775 if (!memcmp(host, &addr, hlen)) {
2776 ret = LDAP_SUCCESS;
2777 break;
2778 }
2779 }
2780 } while (( cur = CERT_GetNextGeneralName( cur )) != names );
2781altfail:
2782 PORT_FreeArena( arena, PR_FALSE );
2783 SECITEM_FreeItem( &altname, PR_FALSE );
2784 }
2785 /* no altnames matched, try the CN */
2786 if ( ret != LDAP_SUCCESS ) {
2787 /* find the last CN */
2788 CERTRDN *rdn, **rdns;
2789 CERTAVA *lastava = NULL;
2790 char buf[2048];
2791
2792 buf[0] = '\0';
2793 rdns = cert->subject.rdns;
2794 while ( rdns && ( rdn = *rdns++ )) {
2795 CERTAVA *ava, **avas = rdn->avas;
2796 while ( avas && ( ava = *avas++ )) {
2797 if ( CERT_GetAVATag( ava ) == SEC_OID_AVA_COMMON_NAME )
2798 lastava = ava;
2799 }
2800 }
2801 if ( lastava ) {
2802 SECItem *av = CERT_DecodeAVAValue( &lastava->value );
2803 if ( av ) {
2804 if ( av->len == nlen && !strncasecmp( name, (char *)av->data, nlen )) {
2805 ret = LDAP_SUCCESS;
2806 } else if ( av->data[0] == '*' && av->data[1] == '.' &&
2807 domain && dlen == av->len - 1 && !strncasecmp( domain,
2808 (char *)(av->data+1), dlen )) {
2809 ret = LDAP_SUCCESS;
2810 } else {
2811 int len = av->len;
2812 if ( len >= sizeof(buf) )
2813 len = sizeof(buf)-1;
2814 memcpy( buf, av->data, len );
2815 buf[len] = '\0';
2816 }
2817 SECITEM_FreeItem( av, PR_TRUE );
2818 }
2819 }
2820 if ( ret != LDAP_SUCCESS ) {
2821 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_ANY, "TLS: hostname (%s) does not match "
2822 "common name in certificate (%s).\n",
2823 name, buf, 0 );
2824 ret = LDAP_CONNECT_ERROR;
2825 if ( ld->ld_error ) {
2826 LDAP_FREE( ld->ld_error );
2827 }
2828 ld->ld_error = LDAP_STRDUP(
2829 _("TLS: hostname does not match CN in peer certificate"));
2830 }
2831 }
2832
2833fail:
2834 CERT_DestroyCertificate( cert );
2835 return ret;
2836}
2837
2838static int
2839tlsm_session_strength( tls_session *session )
2840{
2841 tlsm_session *s = (tlsm_session *)session;
2842 int rc, keySize;
2843
2844 rc = SSL_SecurityStatus( s, NULL, NULL, NULL, &keySize,
2845 NULL, NULL );
2846 return rc ? 0 : keySize;
2847}
2848
2849/*
2850 * TLS support for LBER Sockbufs
2851 */
2852
2853static PRStatus PR_CALLBACK
2854tlsm_PR_Close(PRFileDesc *fd)
2855{
2856 int rc = PR_SUCCESS;
2857
2858 /* we don't need to actually close anything here, just
2859 pop our io layer off the stack */
2860 fd->secret = NULL; /* must have been freed before calling PR_Close */
2861 if ( fd->lower ) {
2862 fd = PR_PopIOLayer( fd, tlsm_layer_id );
2863 /* if we are not the last layer, pass the close along */
2864 if ( fd ) {
2865 if ( fd->dtor ) {
2866 fd->dtor( fd );
2867 }
2868 rc = fd->methods->close( fd );
2869 }
2870 } else {
2871 /* we are the last layer - just call our dtor */
2872 fd->dtor(fd);
2873 }
2874
2875 return rc;
2876}
2877
2878static PRStatus PR_CALLBACK
2879tlsm_PR_Shutdown(PRFileDesc *fd, PRShutdownHow how)
2880{
2881 int rc = PR_SUCCESS;
2882
2883 if ( fd->lower ) {
2884 rc = PR_Shutdown( fd->lower, how );
2885 }
2886
2887 return rc;
2888}
2889
2890static int PR_CALLBACK
2891tlsm_PR_Recv(PRFileDesc *fd, void *buf, PRInt32 len, PRIntn flags,
2892 PRIntervalTime timeout)
2893{
2894 struct tls_data *p;
2895 int rc;
2896
2897 if ( buf == NULL || len <= 0 ) return 0;
2898
2899 p = tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( fd );
2900
2901 if ( p == NULL || p->sbiod == NULL ) {
2902 return 0;
2903 }
2904
2905 rc = LBER_SBIOD_READ_NEXT( p->sbiod, buf, len );
2906 if (rc <= 0) {
2907 tlsm_map_error( errno );
2908 if ( errno == EAGAIN || errno == EWOULDBLOCK ) {
2909 p->nonblock = PR_TRUE; /* fd is using non-blocking io */
2910 } else if ( errno ) { /* real error */
2911 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
2912 "TLS: error: tlsm_PR_Recv returned %d - error %d:%s\n",
2913 rc, errno, STRERROR(errno) );
2914 }
2915 } else if ( ( rc > 0 ) && ( len > 0 ) && ( p->firsttag == LBER_DEFAULT ) ) {
2916 p->firsttag = (ber_tag_t)*((char *)buf);
2917 }
2918 p->io_flag = TLSM_READ;
2919
2920 return rc;
2921}
2922
2923static int PR_CALLBACK
2924tlsm_PR_Send(PRFileDesc *fd, const void *buf, PRInt32 len, PRIntn flags,
2925 PRIntervalTime timeout)
2926{
2927 struct tls_data *p;
2928 int rc;
2929
2930 if ( buf == NULL || len <= 0 ) return 0;
2931
2932 p = tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( fd );
2933
2934 if ( p == NULL || p->sbiod == NULL ) {
2935 return 0;
2936 }
2937
2938 rc = LBER_SBIOD_WRITE_NEXT( p->sbiod, (char *)buf, len );
2939 if (rc <= 0) {
2940 tlsm_map_error( errno );
2941 if ( errno == EAGAIN || errno == EWOULDBLOCK ) {
2942 p->nonblock = PR_TRUE;
2943 } else if ( errno ) { /* real error */
2944 Debug( LDAP_DEBUG_TRACE,
2945 "TLS: error: tlsm_PR_Send returned %d - error %d:%s\n",
2946 rc, errno, STRERROR(errno) );
2947 }
2948 }
2949 p->io_flag = TLSM_WRITE;
2950
2951 return rc;
2952}
2953
2954static int PR_CALLBACK
2955tlsm_PR_Read(PRFileDesc *fd, void *buf, PRInt32 len)
2956{
2957 return tlsm_PR_Recv( fd, buf, len, 0, PR_INTERVAL_NO_TIMEOUT );
2958}
2959
2960static int PR_CALLBACK
2961tlsm_PR_Write(PRFileDesc *fd, const void *buf, PRInt32 len)
2962{
2963 return tlsm_PR_Send( fd, buf, len, 0, PR_INTERVAL_NO_TIMEOUT );
2964}
2965
2966static PRStatus PR_CALLBACK
2967tlsm_PR_GetPeerName(PRFileDesc *fd, PRNetAddr *addr)
2968{
2969 struct tls_data *p;
2970 ber_socklen_t len;
2971
2972 p = tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( fd );
2973
2974 if ( p == NULL || p->sbiod == NULL ) {
2975 return PR_FAILURE;
2976 }
2977 len = sizeof(PRNetAddr);
2978 return getpeername( p->sbiod->sbiod_sb->sb_fd, (struct sockaddr *)addr, &len );
2979}
2980
2981static PRStatus PR_CALLBACK
2982tlsm_PR_GetSocketOption(PRFileDesc *fd, PRSocketOptionData *data)
2983{
2984 struct tls_data *p;
2985 p = tlsm_get_pvt_tls_data( fd );
2986
2987 if ( p == NULL || data == NULL ) {
2988 return PR_FAILURE;
2989 }
2990
2991 /* only the nonblocking option is supported at this time
2992 MozNSS SSL code needs it */
2993 if ( data->option != PR_SockOpt_Nonblocking ) {
2994 PR_SetError(PR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_ERROR, 0);
2995 return PR_FAILURE;
2996 }
2997#ifdef HAVE_FCNTL
2998 int flags = fcntl( p->sbiod->sbiod_sb->sb_fd, F_GETFL );
2999 data->value.non_blocking = (flags & O_NONBLOCK) ? PR_TRUE : PR_FALSE;
3000#else /* punt :P */
3001 data->value.non_blocking = p->nonblock;
3002#endif
3003 return PR_SUCCESS;
3004}

3010 return PR_FAILURE;
3011}

3014tlsm_PR_pfd_unimp()

3016 PR_SetError(PR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_ERROR, 0);
3017 return NULL;
3018}

3042}

3044static const PRIOMethods tlsm_PR_methods = {
3045 PR_DESC_LAYERED,
3046 tlsm_PR_Close, /* close */
3047 tlsm_PR_Read, /* read */
3048 tlsm_PR_Write, /* write */
3049 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* available */
3050 tlsm_PR_i64_unimp, /* available64 */
3051 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* fsync */
3052 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* seek */
3053 tlsm_PR_i64_unimp, /* seek64 */
3054 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* fileInfo */
3055 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* fileInfo64 */
3056 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* writev */
3057 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* connect */
3058 tlsm_PR_pfd_unimp, /* accept */
3059 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* bind */
3060 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* listen */
3061 (PRShutdownFN)tlsm_PR_Shutdown, /* shutdown */
3062 tlsm_PR_Recv, /* recv */
3063 tlsm_PR_Send, /* send */
3064 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* recvfrom */
3065 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* sendto */
3066 (PRPollFN)tlsm_PR_i16_unimp, /* poll */
3067 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* acceptread */
3068 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* transmitfile */
3069 tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* getsockname */
3070 tlsm_PR_GetPeerName, /* getpeername */
3071 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* getsockopt OBSOLETE */
3072 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* setsockopt OBSOLETE */
3073 tlsm_PR_GetSocketOption, /* getsocketoption */
3074 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* setsocketoption */
3075 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* Send a (partial) file with header/trailer*/
3076 (PRConnectcontinueFN)tlsm_PR_prs_unimp, /* connectcontinue */
3077 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* reserved for future use */
3078 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* reserved for future use */
3079 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp, /* reserved for future use */
3080 tlsm_PR_i32_unimp /* reserved for future use */
3081};
3082
3083/*
3084 * Initialize TLS subsystem. Should be called only once.
3085 * See tlsm_deferred_init for the bulk of the init process
3086 */
3087static int
3088tlsm_init( void )
3089{
3090 char *nofork = PR_GetEnv( "NSS_STRICT_NOFORK" );
3091
3092 PR_Init(0, 0, 0);
3093
3094 tlsm_layer_id = PR_GetUniqueIdentity( "OpenLDAP" );
3095
3096 /*
3097 * There are some applications that acquire a crypto context in the parent process
3098 * and expect that crypto context to work after a fork(). This does not work
3099 * with NSS using strict PKCS11 compliance mode. We set this environment
3100 * variable here to tell the software encryption module/token to allow crypto
3101 * contexts to persist across a fork(). However, if you are using some other
3102 * module or encryption device that supports and expects full PKCS11 semantics,
3103 * the only recourse is to rewrite the application with atfork() handlers to save
3104 * the crypto context in the parent and restore (and SECMOD_RestartModules) the
3105 * context in the child.
3106 */
3107 if ( !nofork ) {
3108 /* will leak one time */
3109 char *noforkenvvar = PL_strdup( "NSS_STRICT_NOFORK=DISABLED" );
3110 PR_SetEnv( noforkenvvar );
3111 }
3112
3113 return 0;
3114}
3115
3116static int
3117tlsm_sb_setup( Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod, void *arg )
3118{
3119 struct tls_data *p;
3120 tlsm_session *session = arg;
3121 PRFileDesc *fd;
3122
3123 assert( sbiod != NULL );
3124
3125 p = LBER_MALLOC( sizeof( *p ) );
3126 if ( p == NULL ) {
3127 return -1;
3128 }
3129
3130 fd = PR_GetIdentitiesLayer( session, tlsm_layer_id );
3131 if ( !fd ) {
3132 LBER_FREE( p );
3133 return -1;
3134 }
3135
3136 fd->secret = (PRFilePrivate *)p;
3137 p->session = session;
3138 p->sbiod = sbiod;
3139 p->firsttag = LBER_DEFAULT;
3140 sbiod->sbiod_pvt = p;
3141 return 0;
3142}
3143
3144static int
3145tlsm_sb_remove( Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod )
3146{
3147 struct tls_data *p;
3148
3149 assert( sbiod != NULL );
3150 assert( sbiod->sbiod_pvt != NULL );
3151
3152 p = (struct tls_data *)sbiod->sbiod_pvt;
3153 PR_Close( p->session );
3154 LBER_FREE( sbiod->sbiod_pvt );
3155 sbiod->sbiod_pvt = NULL;
3156 return 0;
3157}
3158
3159static int
3160tlsm_sb_close( Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod )
3161{
3162 struct tls_data *p;
3163
3164 assert( sbiod != NULL );
3165 assert( sbiod->sbiod_pvt != NULL );
3166
3167 p = (struct tls_data *)sbiod->sbiod_pvt;
3168 PR_Shutdown( p->session, PR_SHUTDOWN_BOTH );
3169 return 0;
3170}
3171
3172static int
3173tlsm_sb_ctrl( Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod, int opt, void *arg )
3174{
3175 struct tls_data *p;
3176
3177 assert( sbiod != NULL );
3178 assert( sbiod->sbiod_pvt != NULL );
3179
3180 p = (struct tls_data *)sbiod->sbiod_pvt;
3181
3182 if ( opt == LBER_SB_OPT_GET_SSL ) {
3183 *((tlsm_session **)arg) = p->session;
3184 return 1;
3185
3186 } else if ( opt == LBER_SB_OPT_DATA_READY ) {
3187 if ( p && ( SSL_DataPending( p->session ) > 0 ) ) {
3188 return 1;
3189 }
3190
3191 }
3192
3193 return LBER_SBIOD_CTRL_NEXT( sbiod, opt, arg );
3194}
3195
3196static ber_slen_t
3197tlsm_sb_read( Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod, void *buf, ber_len_t len)
3198{
3199 struct tls_data *p;
3200 ber_slen_t ret;
3201 int err;
3202
3203 assert( sbiod != NULL );
3204 assert( SOCKBUF_VALID( sbiod->sbiod_sb ) );
3205
3206 p = (struct tls_data *)sbiod->sbiod_pvt;
3207
3208 ret = PR_Recv( p->session, buf, len, 0, PR_INTERVAL_NO_TIMEOUT );
3209 if ( ret < 0 ) {
3210 err = PR_GetError();
3211 if ( err == PR_PENDING_INTERRUPT_ERROR || err == PR_WOULD_BLOCK_ERROR ) {
3212 sbiod->sbiod_sb->sb_trans_needs_read = 1;
3213 sock_errset(EWOULDBLOCK);
3214 }
3215 } else {
3216 sbiod->sbiod_sb->sb_trans_needs_read = 0;
3217 }
3218 return ret;
3219}
3220
3221static ber_slen_t
3222tlsm_sb_write( Sockbuf_IO_Desc *sbiod, void *buf, ber_len_t len)
3223{
3224 struct tls_data *p;
3225 ber_slen_t ret;
3226 int err;
3227
3228 assert( sbiod != NULL );
3229 assert( SOCKBUF_VALID( sbiod->sbiod_sb ) );
3230
3231 p = (struct tls_data *)sbiod->sbiod_pvt;
3232
3233 ret = PR_Send( p->session, (char *)buf, len, 0, PR_INTERVAL_NO_TIMEOUT );
3234 if ( ret < 0 ) {
3235 err = PR_GetError();
3236 if ( err == PR_PENDING_INTERRUPT_ERROR || err == PR_WOULD_BLOCK_ERROR ) {
3237 sbiod->sbiod_sb->sb_trans_needs_write = 1;
3238 sock_errset(EWOULDBLOCK);
3239 ret = 0;
3240 }
3241 } else {
3242 sbiod->sbiod_sb->sb_trans_needs_write = 0;
3243 }
3244 return ret;
3245}
3246
